abbreviations: Double spike st = Yoh and insert hook in row indicated and draw up a long loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Charger is worked in rounds with RS always facing.
• Join yarn with sl st at beg of rnds and at end of rnds where indicated.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.
With A, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in magic loop. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 6 (counts as 1 dc and ch-3 sp). (1 dc in next sc. Ch 3) 7 times. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-6. Fasten off. 8 ch-3 sps.
3rd rnd: Join B to any ch-3 sp. [Ch 3 (does not count as dc). 3 dc in ch-3 sp. Ch 3 (does not count as dc). Sl st into same ch-3 sp. Sl st into next ch-3 sp] 8 times. Fasten off. 8 petals.
4th rnd: Join C to first dc in any petal. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 dc. Ch 3. (1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Ch 3) 7 times. Join to first sc. 24 sc and 8 ch-3 sps.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 4 sc in next ch-3 sp. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 4 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around. Join to first sc. Break C. Join A. 56 sc.
6th rnd: With A, ch 8 (counts as dc and ch-5 sp). Skip next 4 sc. *1 dc in next sc. Ch 5. Skip next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. Skip last sc. Join to 3rd ch of beg ch-8. Fasten off. 11 ch-5 sps.
7th rnd: Join B to any ch-5 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 5 dc in ch-5 sp. *Trfp around next dc. 6 dc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to last dc. 1 Trfp around last dc. Join to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off. 77 sts.
8th rnd: Join D to top of any trfp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 4 dc in same st. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc.** 5 dc in next trfp. Rep from * 9 times more, then from * to ** once. Join to top of beg ch-3. Break D. Join A. 77 dc and 22 ch-2 sps.
9th rnd: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each each of next 4 dc. *1 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp.** 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * 9 times more, then from * to ** once. Join to top of beg ch-3. Break A. Join C. 99 dc.
10th rnd: With C, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. (1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) twice.** 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * 9 times more, then from * to ** once. Join to top of beg ch-3. Break C. Join A. 88 dc and 22 ch-1 sps.
11th rnd: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *Ch 1. Skip ch-1 sp. 3 dc in sp between next two dc. Ch 1. Skip ch-1 sp.** 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * 9 times more, then from * to ** once. Join to top of beg ch-3. Break A. Join D. 99 dc and 22 ch-1 sps.
12th rnd: With D, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *Double spike st in ch-1 sp 2 rnds below. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Double spike st in ch-1 sp 2 rnds below.** 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * 9 times more, then from * to ** once. Join to top of beg ch-3. Break D. Join B. 132 sts.
13th rnd: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 6 sts. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 5 dc in sp between next two dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc.** 1 dc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * 9 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in next st. Join to top of beg ch-3. Break B. Join C. 143 dc and 22 ch-1 sps.
14th rnd: With C, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. *Double spike st in skipped dc 2 rnds below. 1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Double spike st in skipped dc 2 rnds below.** 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Rep from * 9 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in next dc. Fasten off. 165 sts.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread”: 2 balls 226 Natural
Crochet Hook: Steel crochet hook size 1.5mm [US 7]
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 12 sts and 5 rows in pattern = 1”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE: Use any size hook to obtain required gauge.
instructions:
DOILY
Ch 75.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in each ch across, turn—73 dc; 24 blocks.
Row 2: Ch 8 (counts as ch 5 and dc), dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 4 ch (2 blocks),  *dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next 2 sts; repeat from * 23 times, dc in next dc, [tr in base of last st made] 6 times (2 blocks), turn—24 spaces and 4 blocks.
Rows 3-110: Work in blocks, spaces, double spaces and lacets following chart. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Size 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 14 dc and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed.
BAG
With MC, ch 31.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 30 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 45 sc.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 1 dc in first sc. (1 dc in each of next 14 sc. 2 dc in next sc) twice. 1 dc in each of next 14 sc. Turn. 48 dc.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 1 dc in each of next 23 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of next 24 dc. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 1 dc in each of next 23 dc. With MC, 1 dc in each of next 24 dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 12 ins [30.5 cm], ending with WS facing for next row. Break A.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). (Yoh and draw up loop in next dc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw yarn through all 3 loops on hook - dc2tog made.
*1 dc in next dc. Dc2tog over next 2 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 32 dc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Daisy Motif: With A, ch 5. Join in rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in rnd. Join B with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 petals.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in missed sc in last rnd. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in next missed sc in last rnd. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 petals.
Note: 5 petals from 2nd rnd should alternate with 5 petals from 3rd rnd. Fasten off.
Leaf Motif: With C, ch 8. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. (2 dc in next ch) twice. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in last ch. Do not turn. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, proceed as follows: Sl st in bottom loop of last ch. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. (2 dc in next ch) twice. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With tapestry needle and C, embroider stem using chain st, on front of Bag, as shown on picture. Sew on Daisy Motif and Leaf Motifs as shown in picture.
Handle: Join MC with sl st to 8th sc on top of Bag and make a chain 10 ins [25.5 cm] long. Join with sl st to 22nd sc on top of Bag. Turn chain sideways. Sl st in center ‘bump’ at back of 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in next bump and each bump to end of ch. Fasten off. Secure ends.
Sew back seam.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each of 310 Copper Mist A, 661 Frosty Green B and 420 Cream C; 2 balls 131 Fudge Brown D
Susan Bates® Steel Crochet Hook: 1.7 mm [US 5]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parentheses into specified st or sp
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Table Runner measures 14¼ x 36¾” (36 x 93.5 cm)
gauge: Motifs measure 2¼ x 2¼” (5.5 X 5.5 cm), CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Welcome the season with the warm fall colors in this lovely table runner. You’ll have a beautiful accent for your table from the first crisp morning through Thanksgiving.
Round 4: With right side facing, join D in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same space, *[ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1, 3 dc in next FPtr] twice, ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1**, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next corner space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st to top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off D. 
Motif #2 (joined on one side)
Repeat rounds 1-3 of Motif #1.
Round 4: With right side facing, join D in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, 2 dc in same space, ch 1, holding wrong sides of motifs together to join them, slip st in corner ch-3 space of previous motif, ch 1, 3 dc same corner space of current motif, [ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group holding back last 2 loops, draw up a loop in FPtr on previous motif, draw through all loops on hook, ch 1, 3 dc in next FPtr] twice, ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group holding back last 2 loops, draw up a loop in FPtr on previous motif, draw through all loops on hook, ch 1, 3 dc in next corner space, ch 1, slip stitch in next ch-3 corner space on previous motif, ch 1, 3 dc in same corner space on current motif, *[ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1, 3 dc in next FPtr] twice, ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1**, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * once; repeat from * to ** once; join with slip st to top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off D. 
Motifs #3-15
Work same as Motif #2, joining to previous motif on opposite side, forming a strip of 15 motifs.

First Strip
Motif #1
With A, ch 6; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 3, 2 dc in ring, [ch 3, 3 dc in ring] 3 times, ch 3; join with a slip stitch to top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off A. 
Round 2: With right side facing, join B in any ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same space, ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1, *(3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in corner space, ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1; repeat from * twice; join with slip st to top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off B.
Round 3: With right side facing, join C in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same space, *ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1, 3 dc in next FPtr, ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1**, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next corner space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st to top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off C.
Designed by Joyce Geisler

Second Strip
Motif #16
Work same as Motif #2, joining to bottom edge of Motif #1.
Motif #17 (joined on 2 sides)
Repeat rounds 1-3 of Motif #1.
Round 4: With right side facing, join D in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, 2 dc in same space, ch 1, holding wrong sides of motifs together to join them, slip st in corresponding corner ch-3 space of previous motif, ch 1, 3 dc same corner space of current motif, *[ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group holding back last 2 loops, draw up a loop in FPtr on previous motif, draw through all loops on hook, ch 1, 3 dc in next FPtr] twice, ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group holding back last 2 loops, draw up a loop in FPtr on previous motif, draw through all loops on hook, ch 1, 3 dc in next corner space, ch 1, slip stitch in next ch-3 corner space on previous motif, ch 1, 3 dc in same corner space on current motif; repeat from * once, **[ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1, 3 dc in next FPtr] twice, ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1**, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from ** to ** once; join with slip st to top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off D.
Motifs #18-30
Work same as Motif #17.

Third through Fifth Strip
Repeat Second Strip, joining to previous strip while completing last round of each motif.

BORDER
Round 1: With right side facing, join D with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same space, *[ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1, 3 dc in next FPtr], 3 times, ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1**, 3 dc in slip stitch where motifs are joined; repeat from * across to next corner ch-3 space, ending last repeat at **, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st to top of beginning ch-3.
Round 2: Slip st to next corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same space, *ch 1, FPtr around the post of center dc of next 3-dc group, ch 1, 3 dc in next FPtr; repeat from * across to next corner ch-3 space**, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in corner space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st to top of beginning ch-3.
Round 3: Repeat Round 2.
Fasten off. Weave in ends. Block and starch as desired.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) contrast A White (00001) 2 balls
Size U.S. h/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Motif (make 6)
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: ch 3. 1 dc in ring – counts as cluster. *ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in ring. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – cluster made. rep from * 6 times more. ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break A.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st in top of any cluster. ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *ch 2. (cluster. ch 3. Sl st. ch 4. 1 tr. ch 4. Sl st. ch 3. cluster) all in top of next cluster. ch 2.** 1 sc in top of next cluster. rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 ch and top of next cluster. ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *ch 3. 1 sc in next tr. ch 3. 1 sc in top of next cluster. ch 3.** Miss next sc. 1 sc in top of next cluster. rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Miss last sc. Join A with sl st to first sc. Break B.
4th rnd: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *ch 1. (3 dc. ch 2. 3 dc) in next sc for corner.** (ch 1. 3 dc in next sc) twice. rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. ch 1. 3 dc in last sc. ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (3 dc. ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp.** (1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. (1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With A, sew Motifs tog into 2 strips, each 3 Motifs wide. Sew strips tog.
edging: 1st rnd: (rS.) Join A with sl st in any corner ch-2 sp. [ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1 sp). (1 dc. ch 1) 3 times] all in same sp. *Miss next dc. (1 dc in next dc. ch 1. Miss next dc) 10 times. 1 dc in joining sp between Motifs. ch 1.* rep from * to * to next corner ch-2 sp. (1 dc. ch 1) 4 times in next corner ch-2 sp.** rep from * to ** twice more, then rep from * to * to last corner ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *ch 5. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. rep from * around; ending with ch 5. Miss last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. Break B.
3rd rnd: Working behind 2nd rnd, join A with sl st in any missed ch-1 sp from last rnd. ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *ch 5. Working in front of 2nd rnd, 1 sc in next missed ch-1 sp from last rnd. ch 5. Working behind 2nd rnd, 1 sc in next missed ch-1 sp from last rnd. rep from * around; ending with ch 5. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic Crochet Thread Size 10 (350 yds)
Size U.S. 7 (1.5 mm) steel crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: 2-tr joining = Holding last loop of each st on hook, 1 tr in next ch-5 sp on current Motif. 1 tr in next ch-5 sp on next outside Motif. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
4-tr cl (4-treble crochet cluster) = Holding last loop of each st on hook, 2 tr in same ch-4 sp. 2 tr in next ch-4 sp. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook
4-dc cl (4-double crochet cluster) = Holding last loop of each st on the hook, 2 dc in same ch-4 sp. 2 dc in next ch-4 sp. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook
5-dc cl (5-double crochet cluster) = Holding last loop of each st on hook, 2 dc in same ch-4 sp. 3 dc in next ch-4 sp. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook
Beg puff st (beg puff st) = Draw up a loop the height of dc. (Yoh and draw up a loop the height of dc) 5 times in indicated st or sp. Yoh and draw through all 11 loops on hook. Ch 1 to close stitch
Ch-3 picot = Ch 3. Sl st in top of indicated st
Ch-4 picot = Ch 4. Sl st in top of indicated st
Dtr = (Double treble crochet). (Yoh) 3 times. Insert hook in next stitch and pull up a loop. (Yoh and draw up a loop through 2 loops on hook) 4 times
dtr joining = Holding last loop of each st on hook, 1 dtr in next sc. Skip next 9 sc. 1 dtr in next sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
etr (extended treble crochet) = (Yoh) twice and pull up a loop (4 loops on hook). Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook (4 loops on hook). (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
Joining picot = Ch 1. Sl st in next picot on adjoining Motif. Ch 1. Sl st in top of last dc made.
gauge: Motif #1 = 3½" [9 cm] diameter
instructions:
Note
Motifs are joined as they are worked. To make finishing easier, weave in all ends as each section of each Motif is completed.
DOILY
Motif #1  (Beg Motif in Center Section)
With A, ch 5. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2) 6 times in ring. Join with sl st in first sc. 6 sc and 6 ch-2 loops.
2nd rnd: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Beg puff st in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. *Ch 4. Puff st in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 4. Sl st in top of beg puff st. Fasten off and weave in ends.
3rd rnd: With RS facing, join B in any ch-4 sp. *Ch 3. 4-tr cl. Ch-4 picot in top of cluster just made. Ch 4. Sl st in same ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 4-dc cl. Ch-4 picot in top of cluster just made. Ch 3. Sl st in same ch-4 sp. Rep from * once. Ch 3. 4-tr cl. Ch-4 picot in top of cluster just made. Ch 4. Sl st in same ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 5-dc cl. Ch 1. 1 dc in top of cluster just made to form final picot.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in picot just made. *Ch 5. etr between clusters in next ch-4 sp of 2nd rnd. Ch 5. (1 tr. Ch 7. 1 tr) in next picot. Ch 5. etr between clusters in next ch-4  sp of 2nd rnd. Ch 5. 1 sc in next picot. Rep from *. 
Ch 5. etr between clusters in next ch-4 sp of 2nd rnd. Ch 5. (1 tr. Ch 7. 1 tr) in next picot. Ch 5. etr between clusters in next ch-4 sp of 2nd rnd. Ch 5. 1 sc in next picot. Rep from *. 
Ch 5. etr between clusters in next ch-4 sp of 2nd rnd. Ch 5. (1 tr. Ch 7. 1 tr) in next picot. Ch 5. etr between clusters in next ch-4 sp of 2nd rnd. Ch 5. Sl st in first sc. Fasten off and weave in ends.
5th rnd: Join A in first sc of previous rnd. Ch 5. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook (counts as dc and picot), *Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next  etr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. (1 dc. Ch 2. Puff  st. Ch 5. Puff st. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-7 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5  sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next etr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2**. 1 dc in next sc. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Rep from * once, then rep from * to **. Sl st in 2nd ch of beg ch-5. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Motif #2 (One-Sided Joining Motif in Center Section)
1st to 4th rnds: Same as Motif #1.
5th rnd: Join A in first sc of previous rnd. Ch 5. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook (counts as dc and picot). Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next etr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. (1 dc. Ch 2. Puff st. Ch 5. Puff  st. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-7 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5  sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next etr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next sc. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next etr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. 
Ch 2. (1 dc. Ch 2. Puff st) in next ch-7 sp. Ch 2, holding WS tog, sl st between puff sts in any ch-5 sp on previous Motif. Ch 2. (Puff st. Ch 2. 1 dc) in same ch-7 sp on current Motif. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Joining picot. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5  sp. 
Ch 2. 1 dc in next etr. Joining picot. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next sc. Joining picot. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next  etr. Joining picot. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Joining picot. Ch 2. (1 dc. Ch 2. Puff st) in next ch-7 sp. Ch 2. Sl st between puff sts in next ch-5  sp on previous Motif.
Motifs #3-5  (One-Sided Joining Motifs in Center Section)
1st to 4th rnds: Same as Motif #1.
5th rnd: Same as Motif #2, working the sl st joining between puff sts in the ch-5 sp of the first joining of previous Motif.
Motif #6 (Two-Sided Joining Motif in Center Section)
1st to 4th rnds: Same as Motif #1.
5th rnd: Join A in first sc of previous rnd. Ch 5. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook (counts as dc and picot). Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next  etr. 
Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. (1 dc. Ch 2. Puff st) in next ch-7 sp. Ch 2, holding WS tog, sl st between puff sts in the ch-5  sp on outside edge of Motif #1 so current Motif will fit between Motifs #1 and #5. 
Ch 2. (Puff st. Ch 2. 1 dc) in same ch-7 sp on current Motif. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Joining picot. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next etr. Joining picot. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next sc. Joining picot. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5  sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next etr. Joining picot. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Joining picot. Ch 2. (1 dc. Ch 2. Puff st) in next ch-7 sp. Ch 2. Sl st between puff sts in next ch-5 sp on Motif #1. 
Sl st between puff sts in next ch-5 sp on Motif #5. Ch 2. (Puff st. Ch 2. 1 dc) in same ch-7 sp on current Motif. Ch 2. 1 dc in next tr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next etr. Ch-3 picot in last dc made. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-5  sp. Ch 2. Sl st in 2nd ch of beg ch-5. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Motifs #7-12 (Point Motifs on outside of Center Section)
Join one Motif to each outside edge of Motifs #1-6.
1st to 4th rnds: Same as Motif #1.
5th rnd: Same as Motif #2, working the first sl st joining between puff  sts in the ch-5 sp of the outside corner of a Motif in the center section.
Edging
1st rnd: With RS facing, join A in the first dc without a picot at the bottom right of any outside Motif. Ch 1. 1 sc in same dc. (Ch 7. Skip dc with picot. 1 sc in next dc) 5 times. (Ch 7. 1 sc. Ch 7. 1 sc) in next ch-5  sp. Ch 7. 1 sc in next dc. (Ch 7. Skip dc with picot. 1 sc in next dc) 5 times. Ch 3. 2-tr joining. Ch 3. *1 sc in next  dc. (Ch 7. Skip dc with picot. 1 sc in next dc) 5 times. (Ch 7. 1 sc. Ch 7. 1 sc) in next ch-5 sp. Ch 7. 1 sc in next dc. (Ch 7. Skip dc with picot. 1 sc in next dc) 5 times. Ch 3. 2-tr-joining. Ch 3. Rep from * around. Sl st in beg sc. Fasten off and weave in ends.
2nd rnd: Join B in the first ch-7 sp of Round 1. Beg puff st. (Ch 5. Puff  st in next ch-7sp) 6 times. Ch 5. Puff st in same sp. (Ch 5. Puff st in next ch-7 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. *Puff  st in next ch-7 sp. (Ch 5. Puff st in next ch-7 sp) 6 times. Ch 5. Puff st in same sp. (Ch 5. Puff st in next ch-7 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Sl st in top of beg puff st. Fasten off and weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1803 Blue Hawaii A, 1621 Evergreen B, 1704 Bubblegum C, and 1909 Holly Berry D or Holiday colors of choice
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Runner measures 15” wide x 60” long (38 x 152.5 cm).
gauge: 1 motif = 6” (15 cm) from point to point, stretched. Gauge is not critical for this project but keep tension tight.
instructions:
Round 2: Slip st in first ch-1 space, sc in same space, ch 8, sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next dc, *sc in next ch-1 space, ch 8, sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next dc; repeat from * 4 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc and 6 ch-8 spaces.
Round 3: Work ([4 sc, picot] 3 times, 4 sc) in first ch-8 space (spoke made), skip next sc, slip st in next 2 sc, *([4 sc, picot] 3 times, 4 sc) in next ch-8 space, skip next sc, slip st in next 2 sc; repeat from * 4 times; join with slip st in first sc—6 spokes. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With right sides facing, arrange motifs as shown in the assembly diagram. With wrong sides of neighboring spokes held together and matching center picots, sew through ch-4 spaces of center picots to join, matching yarn to one or the other color. Weave in ends.
Wet block runner by stretching spokes of each motif evenly, pin in place, and spray with water. Allow to dry thoroughly before handling.
Runner is made from 28 snowflake motifs arranged into 3 rows of 9, 10, and 9 motifs each.
Each motif is worked in joined rounds with right side facing at all times.
Motifs are sewn to neighboring motifs through center picots in the last rounds. Hold the motifs with wrong sides together as you sew through ch-4 spaces.
Make and join motifs to neighboring motifs according to Assembly Diagram and instructions.
Motif (make 28 – 9 with A, 9 with B, 6 with C, and 4 with D)
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1), dc in ring, *(ch 1, dc) in ring; repeat from * 9 times, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch¬—12 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.

pattern_name: LILY SUGAR'N CREAM STRIPES PLACEMAT TO CROCHET OR KNIT
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Stripes (56.7 g / 2 oz) Crochet Version #21317 (Violet Stripes) 2 balls
OR Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Stripes Super Size (70.9 g / 2.5 oz) Crochet Version #23317 (Violet Stripes) 2 balls
OR Size 5 mm (U.S. 8) knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: Crochet Version 12 sc and 13 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]. Knit Version 18 sts and 24 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in stocking st.
instructions:
CROCHET VERSION
Ch 34.
1st row:(RS). 
1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of ch. Turn. 33 sc. Work in sc for 17 ins [43 cm]. Fasten off.
KNIT VERSION
Cast on 47 sts.
1st row:(WS). K1. *P1. K1. Rep from * to end of row.
Rep last row for 17 ins [43 cm], ending with a RS row. Cast off in pat.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 2 skeins 988 Red/Grey
Cardboard 16” x 6” (40.5 cm x 15 cm) wide or item of similar size (such as a book) for making Tassels
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Size (not including Tassels): 14” x 29” (35.5 cm x 73.5 cm)
gauge: 12 sc and 16 rows sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
END POINTS (Make 2)
Beginning at the start of a color change, ch 42.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Working in back bumps only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—41 sc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 38 sc, sc2tog; turn—39 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 36 sc, sc2tog; turn—37 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 34 sc, sc2tog; turn—35 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 32 sc, sc2tog; turn—33 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 30 sc, sc2tog; turn—31 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 28 sc, sc2tog; turn—29 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 26 sc, sc2tog; turn—27 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 24 sc, sc2tog; turn—25 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 22 sc, sc2tog; turn—23 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 20 sc, sc2tog; turn—21 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 18 sc, sc2tog; turn—19 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 16 sc, sc2tog; turn—17 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 14 sc, sc2tog; turn—15 sc.
Row 15: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 12 sc, sc2tog; turn—13 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 10 sc, sc2tog; turn—11 sc.
Row 17: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog; turn—9 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog; turn—7 sc.
Row 19: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog; turn—5 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog; turn—3 sc.
Row 21: Ch 1, skip first st, sc2tog—1 st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Repeat steps for second End Point, starting with the same color run as the first End Point.

MAIN SECTION
Starting with the beginning of one of the colors, ch 49.
Row 1 (Right Side): Working in back bumps only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—48 sc.
Rows 2-41: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; do not turn.

Edging
With Right Side facing and working in ends of rows, ch 1, work 2 sc in the end of Row 41, work 1 sc in the end of each row across to Row 1, work 2 sc in the end of Row 1.
Rotate piece, work along bottom edge by inserting hook into opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each st across.
Rotate piece, working across the other side edge of rows, work 2 sc in the end of Row 1, sc in the end of each row across to Row 41, work 2 sc in the end of Row 41.
Rotate piece, sc in each sc across top of Row 41; join with slip st in first st—182 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Finishing
Referring to photograph, match the Main Section and one of the End Points together with Right Sides facing. Sew the 2 pieces together using the back loop of the top layer and the front loop of the bottom layer, being careful not to pull yarn too tightly. Repeat for other End Point.
Attach yarn with slip st to first st of Main Section; ch1; with Right Side facing and working in ends of rows, sc evenly around Runner, working 6 sc in the top of each End Point; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off and weave in ends.

TASSELS (Make 2)
Make 2 Ties: ch 70; fasten off and weave in ends. Cut a piece of cardboard 16” x 6” wide (40.5 cm x 15 cm).
Saving some yarn for tying the Tassels, wrap yarn around one edge of the cardboard. Insert one of the Ties through the wraps at the edge of the cardboard and tie tightly to secure. Repeat the process for the other Tie at the opposite edge of the cardboard.
Slip the loops off the cardboard. Lay the looped yarn flat, with one Tie at the left and the other at the right. Using a ruler, locate the mid section of the loops and carefully cut the yarn loops through the middle to form two Tassels.
Gently shake first Tassel to straighten out the yarn strands. Cut 12” (30.5 cm) piece of yarn and wrap yarn around Tassel several times, about 1½” (4 cm) from the top. Knot securely and repeat wrapping and knotting 1-2 more times. Trim ends straight across, about 6-7” (15-18 cm) long. Insert Tie through hole made by the 6 sc in the tip of one End Point and tie in a bow. Repeat for second Tassel.

materials: RED HEART® "Super Saver®", 4-Medium Weight Yarn, Art. E300, 100% acrylic, (7 ounce solids/5 ounce multi-color skeins)
Amount: 6 Ounces each No. 311 White CA and No. 368 Paddy Green CB, and small amount No. 390 Hot Red CC.
abbreviations: CA, CB, CC = Colors A, B, and C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Placemat measures approximately 12" x 18"; Coaster measures approximately 6" across.
gauge: 14 sts = 4"; 6 rnds = 4" in rnds of dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
PLACEMAT
With CA, ch 22. Foundation Row (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across; do not turn – 20 dc. Rnd 1: Ch 3, 8 dc over the post of the last dc made, working in rem lps of beg ch, dc in next 18 sts, 9 dc over ch-3, dc in next 18 dc; join in back lp of ch-3 – 54 sts. Work in back lps only for Rnds 2-8. Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in joining, [dc in next dc; 2 dc in next dc – inc made] 4 times, dc in next 18 dc, inc, [dc in next dc, inc] 4 times, dc in next 18 dc; join – 64 sts. Rnd 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, * dc in next 2 dc, inc, dc in next dc, [inc] 4 times, dc in next dc, inc, dc in next 2 dc, inc, dc in next 18 dc *, inc; rep from * to * once more; join – 80 sts. Rnd 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, [dc in next 2 dc, inc] 7 times, dc in next 18 dc, inc, [dc in next 2 dc, inc] 7 times, dc in last 18 dc; join – 96 sts. Rnd 5: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, [inc, dc in next 2 dc] 7 times, inc, dc in next 26 dc, [inc, dc in next 2 dc] 7 times, inc, dc in last 22 dc, changing to CB; join – 112 sts. Rnd 6: With CB, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, [inc, dc in next 3 dc] 7 times, inc, dc in next 27 dc, [inc, dc in next 3 dc] 7 times, inc, dc in last 23 dc; join – 128 sts. Rnd 7: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, [inc, dc in next 4 dc] 7 times, inc, dc in next 28 dc, [inc, dc in next 4 dc] 7 times, inc, dc in last 23 dc; join – 144 sts. Rnd 8: Ch 3, dc in next 6 dc, [inc, dc in next 7 dc] 5 times, inc, dc in next 31 dc, [inc, dc in next 7 dc] 5 times, inc, dc in last 24 dc; join – 156 sts. Rnd 9 (Work in both lps): Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, * skip next 2 dc, 5 dc in next dc, skip next 2 dc **, sc in next dc; rep from * around, end at **; join to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Finishing: With CC embroider 26 French Knots evenly spaced as shown. COASTER
With CA, ch 5; join with a sl st to form a ring. Rnd 1: Ch 3, 15 dc in ring; join in back lp of ch-3 – 16 sts. Work in back lps only for Rnds 2 and 3. Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in each dc around; join – 32 sts. Rnd 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, dc in next dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 15 times; join, changing to CB – 48 sts. Rnd 4 (Work in both lps): With CB, ch 1, sc in same st as joining, * skip next dc, 5 dc in next dc, skip next dc **, sc in next dc; rep from * around, end at **; join to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Finishing: With CC embroider 12 French Knots as shown.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Blueberry (01725) or Hot Purple (01317) or Soft Violet (00093) 1 ball or 33.5 yds [30.5 m]
Contrast A Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 11.5 yds [10.5 m]
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds and rows does not count as hdc.
TULIP
See diagram on page 2. 
With MC, ch 3. 
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first h dc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 h dc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first h dc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 70 hdc.
8th row: Sl st in each of next 2 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. 3 tr in next hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. (2 tr. Ch 1. 2 tr) all in next hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. 3 tr in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 hdc. Sl st in each of next 3 hdc. Fasten off.
LEAF (make 2)
With A, ch 14.
5 tr in 5th ch from hook. 1 tr in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in last ch. Ch 3. Sl st in same ch as last sl st. Do not turn. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 tr in each of next 3 ch. 5 tr in last ch. Ch 4. Sl st in same ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Leaves to bottom of Tulip as shown in picture.

pattern_name: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton Dish Cloth and Pot Holder
materials: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 50 g/1.75 oz) or (Ombres: 42.5 g/1.5 oz)
Pot Holder: Size 4 mm (U.S. G/6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Dishcloth: Size 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Pot Holder Finished Size: Approx 8 x 8 ins [20.5 x 20.5 cm]. Dish Cloth Finished Size: Approx 11 x 11 ins [28 x 28 cm].
gauge: Pot Holder: 15 sts and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in sc with 4 mm hook. Dish Cloth: 8 loops and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in loop pat with 4.5 mm hook.
instructions:
POT HOLDER
BACK: With MC and 4 mm hook, ch 29. Foundation row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Ch 1. Turn. 28 sts.
1st row: 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Turn. This row forms pat. Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 8 ins [20.5 cm] ending with RS facing for next row. Do not turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Work 22 sc along side edge, 3 sc in first st of lower edge, 1 sc in each of next 26 sts along lower edge, 3 sc in next st, 22 sts along side edge, 3 sc in first st of top edge, 1 sc in each of next 26 sts along top edge, 3 sc in next st. Ss to 1st ch 1. Fasten off.
FRONT: With A, work as given for Back.
Edging: With WS tog, proceed as follows: 1st rnd: Join MC to any st. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 round sc, inc at corners as before. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join A to any st, work 1 round sc, inc at corners as before. Fasten off.
3rd round: With MC work as given for 2nd round.
DISHCLOTH
With MC and 4.5 mm hook, ch 42.
Foundation row: (RS). 1 sc in 4th ch from hook. *Ch 2. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn. 20 loops.
1st row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next ch 2 loop. Ch 2. Rep from * to last ch 2 loop. 1 sc in ch 3 loop. Turn. This row forms pat. Cont in pat until work from beg measures 8 ins [20.5 cm] ending with RS facing for next row. Fasten off.
Border: With RS facing, join A to ch 3 loop at end of last row.
1st round: Ch 1. * (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in corner loop - corner made. Ch 2. (1 sc in next loop. Ch 2) 19 times along side. Rep from * 3 times more. Ss to first sc.
2nd round: * Work corner loop. Ch 2. **1 sc in next loop. Ch 2. Rep from ** to next corner. Rep from * 3 times more. Fasten off.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 495 Wood Violet A, 995 Ocean B, 805 Blue Hawaii C, 480 Delft D
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C etc;
() = work directions in parentheses into same st;
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified;
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = measure about 3” (7.5 cm) across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 6; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc), work 11 more dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as first tr here and throughout), tr in same st as joining, *ch 2, 2 tr in next st; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-4—24 tr and 12 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in next tr, (slip st, ch 1, sc, ch 4, sc) in first ch-2 space, *ch 4, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, ch 4; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc and 24 ch-4 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 4: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in any ch-4 space, ch 7 (counts as tr, ch 3), tr in next ch-4 space, *ch 3, tr in next ch-4 space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-7—24 tr and 24 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 3 (counts as dc), 6 dc in same ch-3 space, ch 5, skip next ch-3 space, 5 dc in next ch-3 space, *ch 5, skip next ch-3 space, 7 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 5, skip next ch-3 space, 5 dc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to last ch-3 space, ch 5, skip last ch-3 space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—Six 7-dc groups, Six 5-dc groups, and 12 ch-5 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 6 dc, 6 dc in next ch-5 space, ch 5, 6 dc in next ch-5 space, *dc in next 7 dc, 6 dc in next ch-5 space, ch 5, 6 dc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—Six 19-dc groups and 6 ch-5 spaces.
Fasten off.
Round 7: [With right side facing, join C with slip st in the 2nd dc of any 19-dc group, ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2 here and throughout), skip next dc, dc in next dc, [ch 2, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 7 times, ch 6, skip next dc, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-5 space, *ch 6, skip next dc, dc in next dc, [ch 2, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 8 times, ch 6, skip next dc, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, ch 6; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—54 dc, 12 sc, 6 picots, 12 ch-6 spaces, and 48 ch-2 spaces (in 6 groups of 9 dc, 2 sc, 1 picot, 2 ch-6 spaces, and 8 ch-2 spaces each).
Round 8: Slip st in first ch-space, ch 5, dc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 6 times, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] twice, *ch 6, dc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 7 times, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] twice; repeat from * around, ch 6; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—6 groups of 8 dc, 4 sc, 2 picots, 3 ch-6 spaces, and 7 ch-2 spaces.
Round 9: Slip st in first ch-space, ch 5, dc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 5 times, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 3 times, *ch 6, dc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 6 times, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 3 times; repeat from * around, ch 6; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—6 groups of 7 dc, 6 sc, 3 picots, 4 ch-6 spaces, and 6 ch-2 spaces.
Round 10: Slip st in first ch-space, ch 5, dc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 4 times, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 4 times, *ch 6, dc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 5 times, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 4 times; repeat from * around, ch 6; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—6 groups of 6 dc, 8 sc, 4 picots, 5 ch-6 spaces, and 5 ch-2 spaces.
Round 11: Slip st in first ch-space, ch 5, dc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 3 times, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 5 times, *ch 6, dc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 4 times, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 5 times; repeat from * around, ch 6; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—6 groups of 5 dc, 10 sc, 5 picots, 6 ch-6 spaces, and 4 ch-2 spaces.
Round 12: Slip st in first ch-space, ch 5, dc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] twice, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 6 times, *ch 6, dc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 3 times, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 6 times; repeat from * around, ch 6; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—6 groups of 4 dc, 12 sc, 6 picots, 7 ch-6 spaces, and 3 ch-2 spaces.
Round 13: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 3, dc in next 2 ch-2 spaces, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 7 times, *ch 6, dc in next 3 ch-2 spaces, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 7 times; repeat from * around, ch 6; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 groups of 3 dc, 14 sc, 7 picots, and 8 ch-6 spaces.
Round 14: (Slip st, beg Cl, ch 7, Cl) in next dc, skip next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 6 times, *ch 6, skip next ch-6 space, skip next dc, (Cl, ch 7, Cl) in next dc, skip next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 6 times; repeat from * around, ch 6; join with slip st in beg Cl—6 groups of 2 clusters, 12 sc, 6 picots, 7 ch-6 spaces, and 1 ch-7 space.
Round 15: Beg Cl in same st as joining, ch 6, (dc, ch 7, dc) in next ch-7 space, ch 6, Cl in next Cl, skip next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 5 times, *ch 6, skip next ch-6 space, Cl in next Cl, ch 6, (dc, ch 7, dc) in next ch-7 space, ch 6, Cl in next Cl, skip next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 5 times; repeat from * around, ch 6, skip last ch-6 space; join with slip st in beg Cl—6 groups of 2 clusters, 2 dc, 10 sc, 5 picots, 8 ch-6 spaces, and 1 ch-7 space.
Round 16: Beg Cl in same st as joining, ch 6, (2 dc, [ch 3, 2 dc] twice) in next ch-7 space, ch 6, Cl in next Cl, skip next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 4 times, *ch 6, skip next ch-6 space, Cl in next Cl, ch 6, (2 dc, [ch 3, 2 dc] twice) in next ch-7 space, ch 6, Cl in next Cl, skip next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 4 times; repeat from * around, ch 6, skip last ch-6 space; join with slip st in beg Cl—6 groups of 2 clusters, 6 dc, 8 sc, 4 picots, 2 ch-3 spaces, and 7 ch-6 spaces.
Round 17: Beg Cl in same st as joining, ch 6, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, [ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] twice, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, ch 6, Cl in next Cl, skip next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 3 times, *ch 6, skip next ch-6 space, Cl in next Cl, ch 6, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, [ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] twice, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, ch 6, Cl in next Cl, skip next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 3 times; repeat from * around, ch 6, skip last ch-6 space; join with slip st in beg Cl—6 groups of 2 clusters, 12 dc, 6 sc, 3 picots, 3 ch-3 spaces, and 6 ch-6 spaces.
Round 18: Beg Cl in same st as joining, ch 6, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, [ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, ch 6, Cl in next Cl, skip next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] twice, *ch 6, skip next ch-6 space, Cl in next Cl, ch 6, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, [ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, ch 6, Cl in next Cl, skip next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] twice; repeat from * around, ch 6, skip last ch-6 space; join with slip st in beg Cl—6 groups of 2 clusters, 15 dc, 4 sc, 2 picots, 4 ch-3 spaces, and 5 ch-6 spaces.
Round 19: Beg Cl in same st as joining, ch 6, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, [ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 4 times, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, ch 6, Cl in next Cl, skip next ch-6 space, ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space, *ch 6, skip next ch-6 space, Cl in next Cl, ch 6, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, [ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 4 times, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, ch 6, Cl in next Cl, ch 6, skip next ch-6 space, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space; repeat from * around, ch 6, skip last ch-6 space; join with slip st in beg Cl—6 groups of 2 clusters, 18 dc, 2 sc, 1 picot, 5 ch-3 spaces, and 4 ch-6 spaces.
Fasten off.
POINTS
With right side facing, draw up a loop of D in next beg Cl.
Row 1 (right side): Beg Cl in same st as joining, ch 4, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, [ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 5 times, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-6 space, ch 4, Cl in next Cl, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—2 clusters, 21 dc, 6 ch-3 spaces, and 2 ch-4 spaces.
Row 2: Beg Cl in beg Cl, ch 4, skip next ch-4 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 5 times, ch 4, skip last ch-4 space, Cl in last Cl, turn—2 clusters, 18 dc, 5 ch-3 spaces, and 2 ch-4 spaces.
Row 3: Beg Cl in beg Cl, ch 4, skip next ch-4 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 1, (Cl, ch 3, Cl) in next ch-3 space, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 4, skip last ch-4 space, Cl in last Cl, turn—4 clusters, 12 dc, 2 ch-1 spaces, 3 ch-3 spaces, and 2 ch-4 spaces.
Row 4: Beg Cl in beg Cl, ch 4, skip next ch-4 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, skip next ch-1 space, (Cl, ch 5, Cl) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, skip next ch-1 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 4, skip last ch-4 space, Cl in last Cl, turn—4 clusters, 6 dc, 2 ch-3 spaces, 2 ch-4 spaces, and 1 ch-5 space.
Row 5: Beg Cl in beg Cl, skip next 2 ch-spaces, (Cl, ch 14, Cl) in center ch-5 space, skip next 2 ch-spaces, Cl in last Cl—4 clusters and 1 ch-14 space.
Fasten off. Repeat to complete a total of 6 points.
EDGING
With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in any ch-14 space.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first tr), work 26 tr in same ch-14 space; *sc in space between last 2 Cl of Row 5 of point; working down side edge of point, [ch 6, sc in base of cluster at end of next row] 5 times, [ch 6, sc in next ch-6 space on last round of doily] twice, ch 6, sc in base of cluster at beginning of Row 1 of next point; working up side edge of next point, [ch 6, sc in base of cluster at beginning of next row] 4 times, ch 6, sc in space between first 2 Cl of Row 5 of point **, 27 tr in next ch-14 space; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—78 ch-6 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 1, beginning in same st as joining, *sc in next 4 tr, ch 8, skip next 3 tr, sc in next 4 tr, ch 12, skip next 5 tr, sc in next 4 tr, ch 8, skip next 3 tr, sc in next 4 tr, [sc in next ch-6 space, ch 6] 5 times, dc in next 3 ch-6 spaces, [ch 6, sc in next ch-6 space] 5 times; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in first sc, ch 1, beginning in same st as joining, *sc2tog, picot, sc2tog, (2 tr, [picot, 2 tr] 5 times) in next ch-8 space, sc2tog, picot, sc2tog, (2 tr, [picot, 2 tr] 8 times) in next ch-12 space, sc2tog, picot, sc2tog, (2 tr, [picot, 2 tr] 5 times) in next ch-8 space, sc2tog, picot, sc2tog, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space, [ch 6, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-6 space] 9 times; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fasten off and weave in ends. Block doily to size and shape.

materials: lily® sugar‘n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1" x 3" [2.5 x 7.5 cm] piece of paper.
measurements: Approx 2½" [6 cm] high x 2½" [6 cm] diameter.
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
apple 
note: Stuff Apple as you work.
Beg at top of Apple with MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 18 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
9th to 12th rnds: As 7th rnd.
13th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Draw up loop in each of next 
2 sc. Yoh and draw loop through all loops on hook – sc2tog made) 6 times. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
14th rnd: As 7th rnd.
15th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 24 sts.
16th rnd: As 7th rnd.
17th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 18 sts.
Lightly stuff Apple.
18th and 19th rnds: As 7th rnd.
20th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 12 sts.
21st rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts. Fasten off, 
leaving a long tail. Finish stuffing Apple. Thread tail through rem sts and 
draw tightly. Gently shape work to look like an apple.
leaF
With A, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 
(2 hdc. Ch 2. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 2 hdc) in next ch. Working into 
opposite side of ch, work 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for stitching.
stem
With B, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in each of next 
4 ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for stitching.
FinisHing
Sew Stem and Leaf to top of Apple as shown in picture.
Handwrite or use a computer to add message to place card. Adhere 
toothpick to end of place card with glue. Gently roll place card around 
toothpick once. Poke end of toothpick into top of Apple.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 2 balls 431 Pumpkin A, 1 ball 12 Black B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 1.6mm [US #6] steel crochet hook
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Table runner measures 40 x 13” (101.5 x 33 cm) not including fringe. Fringe adds about 10” (25.5 cm) to the length.
gauge: 14 mesh = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 128.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 8th ch from hook (first open-mesh made), [ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in next ch] 10 times (10 more open-mesh made), dc in next 21 ch (7 solid-mesh made), [ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in next ch] 4 times (4 open-mesh made), dc in next 27 ch (9 solid-mesh made), [ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in next ch] 10 times (10 open-mesh made), turn—41 mesh.

Row 2: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2 here and throughout), skip first ch-2 space, dc in next dc (first open-mesh made), [ch 2, dc in next dc] 8 times (8 more open-mesh made), 2 dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next 7 dc (3 solid-mesh made), [ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc] 5 times (5 open-mesh made), dc in next 6 dc, [2 dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next dc] 4 times, dc in next 9 dc (9 solid-mesh made), [ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc] 4 times (4 open-mesh made), [2 dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next dc] twice (2 solid-mesh made), [ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc] 8 times (8 open-mesh made), ch 2, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch (last open-mesh made), turn.

Row 3: Ch 5, skip first ch-2 space, dc in next dc, [ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc] 7 times, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next 4 dc, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, [ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc] 4 times, [ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc] 9 times, [ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc] 5 times, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, dc in next 6 dc, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next dc, [ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc] 7 times, ch 2, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.

Rows 4–78: Continue to work pattern following chart.

Rows 79–155: Turn chart upside down and work rows again in opposite order, beginning with Row 77 and working down through Row 1.

Fasten off.

BORDER
Notes
1. First 2 rounds of border will look like a checkerboard of open- and solid-mesh.
2. Notice that there is a column of open-meshes across each long edge of the runner. You will work into the spaces and posts (at top of each row) between the spaces in the same way that you would work across the top of a row of open-meshes.
3. When working across the top edge, work into the stitches (each ch and each dc count as one st) of the last row. When working across the lower edge, work into the opposite side of the foundation chain (each ch counts as one st).

With right side facing, join B with slip st in a corner to work across a long edge of the runner.

Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 2 dc in space at end of next row, ***dc at top of same row, *ch 2, skip space at end of next row, dc at top of row, 2 dc in space at end of next row, dc at top of row; repeat from * across long side edge to next corner space, (3 dc, ch 5, 3 dc) in corner space; working across short edge of runner, dc in next st, ch 2, skip next 2 sts (this may be 2 dc or a ch-2 space), dc in next st, **dc in next 3 sts (this may be 3 dc or a ch-2 space and a dc), ch 2, skip next 2 sts, dc in next st; repeat from ** across short edge to next corner space, (3 dc, ch 5, 3 dc) in corner space; repeat from *** to work border across 2nd long side and 2nd short side ending at last corner space, 3 dc in last corner space, ch 5; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3, do not turn.

Round 2: Ch 5, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, *2 dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * to next corner space, (3 dc, ch 5, 3 dc) in corner space, [dc in next dc, **ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next dc; repeat from ** to next corner space, (3 dc, ch 5, 3 dc) in corner space] 3 times; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5.

Round 3: Ch 5, skip first ch-space, dc in next dc, **ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, *ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * to next corner space, ch 2, (dc, ch 5, dc) in 3rd ch of corner ch-5, ch 2, skip remainder of corner ch-5, dc in next dc; repeat from ** around, ch 2; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5. 
Fasten off.

TRIPLE KNOT FRINGE
Attach Fringe: Cut 4 strands of B, each 12” (30.5 cm) long. Hold all 4 stands together and fold in half. Insert crochet hook from right side to wrong side through first space on one short edge of runner, place fold on hook and draw fold through to right side, thread ends of strands through loop formed by fold and pull on the ends to tighten (fringe knot made). Repeat this process to attach a fringe to every space across both short ends of runner.

First Row of Knots: Turn runner over so wrong side is facing you. Separate first 2 fringes into 2 groups of 4 strands each. Begin with the 2nd group of 4-strands from the first fringe and the first group of 4-strands from the 2nd fringe. Tie the two groups together with an overhand knot and pull tight about ¾” (19 mm) below the fringe knots. Repeat this process all the way across, leaving the last 4-strand group loose. Repeat across other short edge. Note: The first and last 4-strand groups of each short side should be loose.

Second Row of Knots: Beginning with the first (un-tied) 4-strand group from previous row, separate the next group of strands into 2 groups of 4-strands each and tie the first of these two 4-strand groups to the previous 4-strand group with an overhand knot about ¾” (19 mm) below the previous knots. Repeat this process all the way across both short edges. Trim ends as desired.

FINISHING: Weave in ends. Block and starch piece as desired.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet Thread Size 3: 2 balls 65 Warm Teal.
Straight pins and foam surface for blocking (optional).
gauge: Rounds 1-4 = 5½ from point to point. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
Ch 8; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 23 dc in ring; join with a slip st in third ch of beginning ch-3 – 24 dc.
Round 2: Ch 4, * dc in next dc, ch 1, repeat from * around; join with a slip st in third ch of beginning ch-4 – 24 dc and ch-1 space.
Round 3: Ch 3, * 2 dc in next ch-1 space, dc in next dc, repeat from * around, ending last repeat with 2 dc in last space; join with a slip st in third ch of beginning ch-3 – 72 dc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, * skip 2 dc, (dc, ch-1, [tr, ch 1] 3 times, dc – shell made) in next dc; skip 2 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 12 shells.
Round 5: Slip st to center ch-1 space of first shell, ch 1, sc in same space, * ch 7, sc in center ch-1 space of next shell, repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 12 ch-7 loops.
Round 6: Ch 3, [9 dc in next loop, dc in next sc] 12 times; join with slip st in third ch of beginning ch-3 – 120 dc.
Round 7: Ch 4, * skip next dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, repeat from * around; join with slip st in third ch of beginning ch-4 – 60 ch-1 space.
Round 8: Repeat Round 3 – 180 dc.
Round 9: Ch 8, yo, pull up a loop in sixth ch from hook, yo, skip 2 dc, pull up a loop in next dc, [yo and pull through 2 loops] 4 times (begin cross st made), [Cross St] around; join with a slip st in sixth ch of beginning ch-8 – 60 Cross Sts.
Round 10: Ch 3, * 2 dc in next ch-2 space, dc in first leg of next Cross St, repeat from * around; join with a slip st in third ch of beginning ch-3 – 180 dc.
Round 11: Repeat Round 4 – 30 shells.
Round 12: Repeat Round 5 – 30 ch-7 loops.
Round 13: Ch 3, * 7 dc in next loop, dc in next sc, repeat from * around; join with a slip st in third ch of beginning ch-3 – 240 dc.
Round 14: Repeat Round 7 – 120 ch-1 space.
Round 15: Repeat Round 3 – 360 dc.
Round 16: Repeat Round 4 – 60 shells; fasten off.
FINISHING
To block (optional), stretch and pin doily into circle. Spray with water until damp; let dry thoroughly. If not blocking, press gently on WS using cotton setting with steam.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 4 balls 275 Coral
Yarn needle, rustproof pins, spray starch (for stiffening)
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: Rounds 1–3 = 2” (5 cm); 1 motif = 6” (15 cm), blocked and stiffened. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
RUNNER
Motif #1
Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): [Ch 10, slip st in ring] 5 times, ch 5, dtr in base of beginning ch-10—6 ch-10 spaces (ch 5 and dtr count as last ch-10 space).
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout) (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in first ch-10 space, [ch 2, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-10 space] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, [ch 2, dc in next 3 dc, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc, 6 sc, and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Note: Dc2tog is worked over 2 ch-3 spaces (see Special Stitches).
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, ch 3, dc2tog, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, [ch 1, dc in next 3 dc, ch 3, dc2tog, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc] 5 times, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—42 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, ch 3, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next dc, [ch 3, dc in next 6 dc, ch 3, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next dc] 5 times, ch 3, dc in last 3 dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—48 dc, 6 ch-1 spaces, and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-space] twice, ch 1, dc in next 3 dc, [ch 2, dc in next 3 dc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-space] twice, ch 1, dc in next 3 dc] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 1, dc in next 3 dc, [ch 4, dc in next 3 dc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 1, dc in next 3 dc] 5 times, ch 4; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc, 6 ch-3 spaces, and 6 ch-4 spaces.
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, ch 1, dc in next ch-3 space, ch 1, dc in next 3 dc, ch 2, V-st in next ch-4 space, [ch 2, dc in next 3 dc, ch 1, dc in next ch-3 space, ch 1, dc in next 3 dc, ch 2, V-st in next ch-4 space] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—42 dc and 6 V-st.
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in next 6 dc, ch 2, 9 dc in next V-st, [ch 2, dc in next 7 dc, ch 2, 9 dc in next V-st] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—96 dc.
Round 10: Ch 3, dc in next dc, skip next 3 dc, dc in next 2 dc, ch 2, (dc, ch 1) in next 8 dc, dc in next dc, [ch 2, dc in next 2 dc, skip next 3 dc, dc in next 2 dc, ch 2, (dc, ch 1) in next 8 dc, dc in next dc] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—78 dc.
Round 11: Beg dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc, [ch 2, dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 V-sts. Fasten off.
Motif #2
Work same as motif #1 through Round 10—78 dc.
Note: Motif #2 is now joined to motif #1 as the next round is worked. The motifs are joined at 2 V-sts across one side. 
Round 11: Beg dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc, [ch 2, dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st-join in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc] twice, [ch 2, dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc] 3 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 V-sts. Fasten off.
Motifs #3–#9
Work same as motif #2, joining motifs #3–#8 to form the top row and joining motif #9 to motif #1 to begin the middle row.
Motif #10
Work same as motif #1 through Round 10—78 dc.
Note: Motif #10 is now joined to motifs #1 and #9 as the next round is worked. The motifs are joined at 3 V-sts across 2 sides. 
Round 11: Beg dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc, [ch 2, dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st-join in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc] 3 times, [ch 2, dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc] twice, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 V-sts. Fasten off.
Motifs #11–#18
Work same as motif #10, joining motifs #11–#17 to previous motifs to complete the middle row and joining motif #18 to motifs #9 and #10 to begin the bottom row.
Motif #19
Work same as motif #1 through Round 10—78 dc.
Note: Motif #19 is now joined to motifs #10, #11, and #18 as the next round is worked. The motifs are joined at 4 V-sts across 3 sides. 
Round 11: Beg dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc, [ch 2, dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st-join in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc] 4 times, ch 2, dc4tog, ch 2, (dc, ch 2) in next 4 dc, V-st in next dc, (ch 2, dc) in next 4 dc, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 V-sts. Fasten off.
Motifs #20–#25
Work same as motif #19, joining to previous motifs to complete the bottom row.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Wet block, pinning and stretching fully, if necessary, to open pattern. Starch lightly with spray starch and allow to dry thoroughly.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread”, Size 10: 2 (3, 4) balls 536 Passionata A, 2 (3, 4) balls 310 Copper Mist B, 1 (2, 2) balls 494 Victory Red C, 2 (3, 4) balls 131 Fudge Brown D, 2 (3, 4) balls 012 Black E.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D and E = Color A, B, C, D, and E
( ) = work directions in parentheses into indicated st.
measurements: Runner measures 14” wide x 60” long. Changes for lengths of 90” and 120” are in parentheses.
gauge: 44 sts = 4”; 24 rows = 4” in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 508 (838, 1168).
Round 1 (Right Side): Place a marker in the 3rd ch from hook, dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), dc in each remaining ch across to last ch, (V-st, 3 dc, V-st) in last ch; working across opposite side of ch, dc in each ch across to marked ch, (V-st, 4 dc) in marked ch (remove marker), ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—1022 (1682, 2342) dc and 4 corner ch-1 spaces.
Change color according to color sequence.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st around, working a shell in each corner ch-1 space; join with slip st in top of turning ch, turn—1038 (1698, 2358) dc and 4 corner ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in each st around, working a shell in each corner ch-1 space; join with slip st in top of turning ch, turn—1054 (1714, 2374) dc and 4 corner ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in each st around, working a V-st in each corner ch-1 space; join with slip st in top of turning ch, turn—1062 (1722, 2382) dc and 4 ch-1 spaces.
Rounds 5–12: Repeat Rounds 3 and 4 four times; change to B in last st of Round 12.
Rounds 13–42: Beginning with B, repeat Rounds 3 and 4 fifteen times, and continue to change color as in color sequence. Do not fasten off.
FINISHING
Edging
With E, ch 1, sc in each dc around, working 3 sc in each corner ch-1 space; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends. Block lightly.
Our designer has chosen colors with an Asian influence. But this table runner will look just as beautiful in other shades that fit the season and mood of any table setting.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® “Fashion Crochet Thread” Size 3: 3 Balls 226 Natural.
gauge: Motif = 4¼” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
FIRST MOTIF
Ch 10; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 3, 23 dc in ring; join with a slip st to top of ch-3—24 sts.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, * ch 5; holding back last loop on hook, dc in next 3 dc, yo and through all 4 loops on hook—3-dc-cluster (3-dc-cl) made; ch 5, ** dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join with a slip st to top of ch-3.
Rnd 3: Ch 2, holding back last loop on hook, dc in next 2 dc, yo and through all 3 loops on hook—beginning cl made; * [ch 6, sc in next loop] twice **, ch 6, 3-dc-cl; repeat from * around, end at **; ch 3, tr in top of beginning cl to join and form last loop.
Rnd 4: Ch 5, sc in next loop, * ch 5, (3 tr, ch 7, 3 tr) all in next loop **, [ch 5, sc in next loop] twice; repeat from * around, end at **; ch 5; join with a slip st to tr. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

SECOND MOTIF
Rnds 1-3: Work same as First Motif.
To join on one side-Rnd 4: Ch 5, sc in next loop, ch 5, * 3 tr in next loop on current motif, ch 3, sc in ch-7 loop of completed motif, ch 3, 3 tr in same loop on current motif *, [ch 2, sc in next loop on completed motif, ch 2, sc in next loop on current motif] twice, ch 2, sc in next loop on completed motif, ch 2; repeat from * to * once more—one side joined; complete Rnd 4 as for first motif.
Join 3 x 7 motifs, joining on 2 sides as required. Where 4 corners meet, work corner joining sc into previous corner joining sc.
To join on 2 sides-Rnd 4: Ch 5, sc in next loop, ch 5, * 3 tr in next loop on current motif, ch 3, sc in ch-7 loop of completed motif (or in sc of previous joining), ch 3, 3 tr in same loop on current motif **, [ch 2, sc in next loop on completed motif, ch 2, sc in next loop on current motif] twice, ch 2, sc in next loop on completed motif, ch 2; repeat from * once more, then from * to ** once more—2 sides joined; complete Rnd 4 as for first motif.

EDGING-Rnd 1: With right side facing, attach thread in any corner ch-7 loop. Ch 1, ** [sc, ch 7] twice all in corner loop, * sc in next ch-space, ch 7; repeat from * to next corner loop; repeat from ** around; join with a slip st to first sc.

Rnd 2: Slip st in next 2 ch and into ch-7 loop, ch 4, (2 tr, ch 5, 3 tr) all in corner loop, ch 2, * 3 tr in next loop, ch 2 **; repeat from * to next corner; (3 tr, ch 5, 3 tr) all in corner loop, ch 2; repeat from * around, end at **; join with a slip st to top of ch-4. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Super Size (4 oz/113 g; 190 yds/174 m) Main Color (MC) Rainforest (18812) 3 balls or 480 yds/437 m
Contrast A Pretty n’ Pink (18809) 1 ball or 80 yds/73 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® flexible Afghan crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 52" [132 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 sts and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Tunisian Top Stitch Pat. Note: 1 row of Tunisian Top Stitch Pat = Forward and Return Pass.
instructions:
Note: Table Runner is worked lengthwise.
With Tunisian hook and A, ch 174 loosely.
1st row: Forward pass: (Right to left). Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook. Draw up a loop in each rem ch to end of chain, leaving all loops on hook. 173 sts on hook. Do not turn.
Return pass: (Left to right after working Forward pass of each row). Yoh and draw through last loop only (for edge st). *Yoh and draw through 2 loops. Rep from * until 1 loop rem on hook. Do not turn.

2nd row: Forward pass: (Right to left). Draw up a loop in horizontal strand between 2nd and 3rd sts (see photos below). *Draw up a loop in horizontal strand between next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Draw up a loop in horizontal strand between last 2 sts. Draw up a loop in edge st. Return pass.

Rep 2nd row for Tunisian Top Stitch pat 10 times more – 12 rows total have been worked.
Tip: Count sts on hook after Return pass to make sure st count remains 173 sts throughout.

12th row: Forward pass: (Right to left). With MC, work as before. Join A. Return pass with A.
13th row: Forward pass: (Right to left). With A, work Forward Pass as before. Join MC. Return pass with MC.
14th to 17th rows: Rep 12th and 13th rows twice more. Break A.
With MC only work a further 12 rows in Top Stitch pat. Fasten off.
Block Runner with T-pins on a flat surface and steam press on WS of work. Allow Runner to dry and remove pins.
Fringe: Cut 24 lengths of A and 112 lengths of MC 15" [38 cm] long. Taking 4 strands tog, knot 3 fringes with A evenly spaced across center of each end to correspond with A stripes. Taking 4 strands tog, knot 7 fringes with MC evenly spaced across either side of A section on each end as shown. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream Stripes (56.7 g / 2 oz) 10 balls
Size 5 mm (U.S H / 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in every sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in every sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows to 53 sts, ending with 3rd row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row for 52 ins [132 cm], ending with a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Draw up a loop in first 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook - sc2tog made. 1 sc in every sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows to 3 sts, ending with a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Draw up a loop in first 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc3tog made. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Holiday: 1 ball each 9090 Red/Red A, 1360 Aran/Gold B, and 6060 Green/Green C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Coaster Placemat measures 14½” high x 19” wide. Coaster measures 6” across.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PLACEMAT
With A, ch 64.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 63 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3; yo and draw up a loop in first sc, yo and draw through 2 loops, skip next sc, yo and draw up a loop in next sc, yo and draw through 2 loops, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook – CL made; * ch 1, CL (use same sc as last leg of last CL, skip next sc, use next sc); repeat from * across; dc in last sc (same sc as last leg of last CL); turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first dc, * sc in next st, sc in next space; repeat from * to last 2 sts; sc in next st, sc in top of ch-3; turn.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 twelve more times. Fasten off.
Border
Round 1: With right side facing, attach A in first sc of last row worked; ch 1, * (sc, ch 2, sc) all in first st, work 61 sc across to last st, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in last st, work 41 sc along side to next corner sc; repeat from * once more; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 2: Attach B in any corner ch-2 space; (ch 2, [yo and draw up a loop] twice, yo and draw through all 5 loops on hook – begining PS (puff st) made, ch 1; yo and draw up a loop] 3 times, yo and draw through all 7 loops on hook – PS made) all in space, ** ch 1, skip next sc, * PS in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc; repeat from * to next corner ***; (PS, ch 1, PS) all in next corner space; repeat from ** around, end at ***; join in top of begining PS. Fasten off.
Round 3: Attach A in any corner ch-1 space; ch 1, ** (sc, ch 2, sc) all in corner space, ch 2, * sc in next space, ch 2; repeat from * to next corner space; repeat from ** around; join.
Round 4: Slip st into ch-2 space, ch 1, ** ([sc, ch 3] twice, sc) all in corner ch-2 space, * (sc, ch 3, sc) all in next space; repeat from * to next corner; repeat from ** around; join. Fasten off.
Leaf (Make 4)
With C, ch 8; sc in 2nd and 3rd ch from hook, * (hdc; ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook – P3 (picot) made; hdc) all in next ch, sc in next ch, (hdc, P3, hdc) all in next ch *, sc in next ch, (sc, P3, sc) all in last ch; work across opposite side of ch: sc in next ch; repeat from * to * once; sc in last 2 ch, slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Sew 2 Leaves in upper left and lower right corners of placemat. With a double strand of B, make 3 French Knot berries between leaves.
Set your holiday table in style with this lovely set. Alternate the colors so that you use up all 3 balls of yarn. These are perfect small projects for gift giving.

COASTER
With B ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, 16 dc into ring; join with a slip st in top of ch 3 – 17 sts. Fasten off.
Round 2: Attach A in any dc; ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 34 sc.
Round 3: Ch 4, * CL, ch 1; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4 – 17 CL.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in same ch as joining, 2 sc in space, * sc in CL, 2 sc in space; repeat from * around; join – 52 sc. Fasten off.
Border
Round 1: With right side facing, attach B in any sc; begining PS in same sc, ch 1, skip next sc, * PS in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc; repeat from * around; join in top of begining PS – 26 PS. Fasten off.
Round 2: Attach A in any ch-1 space; ch 1, * sc in space, ch 2; repeat from * around; join.
Round 3: Slip st into ch-2 space, ch 1, * (sc, ch 3, sc) all in space; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Super Size (4 oz/113 g; 190 yds/174 m) Overcast (18042) 6 balls or 1120 yds/1020 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Trbp3(6)tog = [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3(6) times. Yoh and draw through all 4(7) loops on hook.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 77 (multiple of 12 ch + 5). See diagram on page 2.
