Round 8: Ch 1, * holding next petal forward, slip st in base of first hdc, ch 3, slip st in base of last hdc, ch 3, repeat from * around; ending with skip ch-1, join with a slip st in 1first slip st – 20 loops.
Round 9: Repeat Round 3 – 20 petals.
Rounds 10-13: Working with 20 petals, repeat Round 4 and Round 3 twice.
Round 14: Ch 1, * [holding next petal forward, slip st in base of center dc, ch 3] 3 times, [holding next petal forward, slip st in base of first hdc, ch 3, slip st in base of last hdc, ch 3] once; repeat from * around, ending with skip ch-1; join with a slip st in first slip st – 25 loops.
Round 15: Repeat Round 3.
Rounds 16-19: Working with 25 petals, repeat Round 4 and Round 3 twice.
Round 20: Repeat Round 4, replacing ch 3 with ch 4.
Round 21: Repeat Round 3, replacing 3 dc with 5 dc; fasten off.
FINISHING
Cut 2 thicknesses of cotton quilt batting to fit back of Potholder. Cut one thickness of felt to fit back of Potholder for lining. Placing 2 layers of cotton quilt batting in center, place lining on top and whipstitch in place.
AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet size 3, Art. 182 available 100% Mercerized Cotton, 150 yd (147m) balls.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Smoothie™: 2 balls each 9341 Grey A, 2138 Refreshing B, and 9287 Caribbean C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parenthesis the number of times specified.
measurements: Table Runner measures 12" [30 cm] x 58" [147 cm].
gauge: 5 blocks = 4" [10 cm]; 5 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern stitch.
instructions:
RUNNER
With A, ch 6.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped first 3 ch count as ch-3 space here and throughout), dc in next 2 ch – 1 block.
Row 2: Ch 6, turn, dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 2 ch, (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space – 2 blocks.
Row 3: Ch 6, turn, dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 2 ch, [(slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space] to end of row – 3 blocks.
Rows 4-15: Following chart for color changes, repeat Row 3, adding one more block each row – 15 blocks on last row worked.
Row 16: Turn, slip st in first 3 sts, [(slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space] to end of row – 15 blocks.
Row 17: Ch 6, turn, dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 2 ch, [(slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space] to last block, slip st in ch-3 space of last block – 15 blocks.
Rows 18-71: Following chart for color changes, repeat Rows 16-17.
Row 72: Following chart for color changes, repeat Row 16.
Rows 73-86: Turn, slip st in first 3 sts, [(slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space] to last block, slip st in ch-3 space of last block – 1 block decreased each row, 1 block remains on last row worked.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 0423 Maize
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 8 dc = 1” (2.5 cm) and 5 rows = 1” (2.5 cm). Use any size hook to obtain your gauge.
instructions:
DOILY
Ch 5, slip st to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 2, 15 dc in ring, slip st into second ch of beginning ch-2 – 16 dc.
Round 2: Slip st around the post of the next dc, ch 7; *skip next dc, fptr in next dc, ch 4*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the third ch of the beginning ch-7 – 8 fptr; 8 ch-4 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st into ch-4 space, ch 2; 5 dc in same space; *ch 1, 6 dc in next ch-4 space*; repeat from * to * around, ending with hdc into the second ch of the beginning ch-2 – 48 dc; 8 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3, 4 tr in same space; *ch 6, skip next 6 dc, 5 tr in next ch-1 space*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a ch 3, edc into the third ch of beginning ch-3 – 40 tr; 8 ch-6 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 2, 3 dc in same space, dc in next tr, hdc in next tr, sc in next tr, triple picot in top of last sc made; slip st around base of triple picot just made, hdc in next tr, dc in next tr; *(4 dc, ch 1, 4 dc) in next ch-6 space; dc in next tr, hdc in next tr, sc in next tr, triple picot in last sc just made, slip st around base of triple picot just made, hdc in next tr, dc in next tr*; repeat from * to * around, ending with 4 dc into beginning ch-6 space; hdc in second ch of beginning ch-2 – 8 ch-1 spaces; 8 triple picots.
Round 6: Ch 3, 4 tr in same space, ch 11; *5 tr in next ch-1 space, ch 11*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a ch 5, trtr into the third ch of beginning ch-3 – 8 ch-11 spaces.
Round 7: Ch 2, 5 dc in same space; *dc in next tr, hdc in next tr, (sc, triple picot in last sc made, slip st around base of triple picot just made, sc) in next tr; hdc in next tr, dc in next tr; (6 dc, ch 1, 6 dc) in next ch-11 space*; repeat from * to * around, ending with 6 dc into the beginning ch-11; hdc into second ch of beginning ch-2 – 8 ch-1 spaces; 8 triple picots.
Round 8: Ch 3, 4 tr in same space, ch 14; *5 tr in next ch-1 space, ch 14*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the third ch of beginning ch-3 – 8 ch-14 spaces.
Round 9: Ch 2, hdc in next tr, sc in next tr, hdc in next tr, dc in next tr, 16 dc in next ch-14 space; *dc in next tr, hdc in next tr, sc in next tr, hdc in next tr, dc in next tr, 16 dc in next ch-14 space*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the second ch of beginning ch-2 – 8 16-dc groups.
Round 10: Slip st across next hdc, sc, and hdc; slip st into next dc, ch 2, dc in next 7 dc, ch 2, skip 2 dc, dc in next 8 dc; *ch 4; skip next hdc, sc, and hdc; dc in next 8 dc, ch 2, skip 2 dc, dc in next 8 dc*; repeat from * to * around, ending with ch 4, slip st into the second ch of beginning ch-2 – 8 ch-4 spaces; 8 ch-2 spaces.
Round 11: Slip st into the next dc, ch 2, dc in next 5 dc, ch 2, skip next dc, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, skip next dc, dc in next 6 dc; ch 4; (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-4 space; ch 4, skip next dc; *dc in next 6 dc, ch 2, skip next dc, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, skip next dc, dc in next 6 dc, ch 4, skip next dc; (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-4 space; ch 4, skip next dc*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the second ch of beginning ch-2 – 16 ch-2 spaces; 16 ch-4 spaces; 8 ch-3 spaces.
Round 12: Slip st into the next dc, ch 2, dc in next 4 dc, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next 5 dc, ch 4, skip next dc; (2 dc, ch 6, slip st into the 6th ch from hook, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space; ch 4, skip next dc; *dc in next 5 dc, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next 5 dc, ch 4, skip next dc; (2 dc, ch 6, slip st into the 6th ch from hook, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space; ch 4, skip next dc*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the second ch of beginning ch-2 – 8 ch-2 spaces; 16 ch-4 spaces; 8 ch-5 loops.
Round 13: Slip st into the next dc, ch 2, dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next 5 dc, ch 7, skip next dc; (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-5 loop; ch 7, skip next dc; *dc in next 5 dc, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next 5 dc, ch 7, skip next dc; (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-5 loop; ch 7, skip next dc*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the second ch of beginning ch-2 - 8 12-dc groups; 16 ch-7 spaces; 8 ch-3 loops.
Round 14: Slip st into the next dc, ch 2, dc in next 9 dc, ch 6, skip next dc, 10 tr in next ch-3 space, ch 6, skip next dc; *dc in next 10 dc, ch 6, skip next dc, 10 tr in next ch-3 space, ch 6, skip next dc*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the second ch of beginning ch-2 – 8 10-dc leaves; 16 ch-2 spaces; 8 10-tr groups.
Round 15: Slip st into next dc, ch 2, dc in next 7 dc, ch 5, skip next dc, dc in back loop of next tr; [ch 1, dc in back loop of next tr] 9 times; ch 5, skip next dc; *dc in next 8 dc, ch 5, skip next dc, dc in back loop of next tr; [ch 1, dc in back loop of next tr] 9 times; ch 5, skip next dc*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the second ch of beginning ch-2 – 16 ch-5 spaces.
Round 16: Slip st into next dc, ch 2, dc in next 5 dc, ch 5, skip next dc, 2-tr cl in next dc; [ch 2, 2-tr cl in next dc] 9 times; ch 5, skip next dc; *dc in next 6 dc, ch 5, skip next dc, 2-tr cl in next dc; [ch 2, 2-tr cl in next dc] 9 times; ch 5, skip next dc*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the second ch of beginning ch-2 – 16 ch-5 spaces.
Round 17: Slip st into next dc, ch 2, dc in next 3 dc, ch 5, skip next dc, sc in top of next cl; [ch 4, sc in top of next cl] 9 times; ch 5, skip next dc; *dc in next 4 dc, ch 5, skip next dc, sc in top of next cl; [ch 4, sc in top of next cl] 9 times; ch 5, skip next dc*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the second ch of beginning ch-2 – 16 ch-5 spaces.
Round 18: Slip st into next dc, ch 2, dc in next dc, ch 5, skip next dc; (3-dc cl, ch 2, 3-dc cl) in next ch-4 space; ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2; (3-dc cl, ch 2, 3-dc cl) in next ch-4 space; ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 3; (3-tr cl, ch 2, 3-tr cl) in next ch-4 space; ch 3, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2; (3-dc cl, ch 2, 3-dc cl) in next ch-4 space; ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2; (3-dc cl, ch 2, 3-dc cl) in next ch-4 space; ch 5, skip next dc; *dc in next 2 dc, ch 5, skip next dc; (3-dc cl, ch 2, 3-dc cl) in next ch-4 space; ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2; (3-dc cl, ch 2, 3-dc cl) in next ch-4 space; ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 3; (3-tr cl, ch 2, 3-tr cl) in next ch-4 space; ch 3, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2; (3-dc cl, ch 2, 3-dc cl) in next ch-4 space; ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2; (3-dc cl, ch 2, 3-dc cl) in next ch-4 space; ch 5, skip next dc*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into the second ch of beginning ch-2 – 16 3-tr clusters; 64 3-dc clusters; 16 ch-5 spaces.
Round 19: Slip st between the first and second dc, ch 1, sc in same space, ch 5; (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-2 space; ch 6, skip next 2 ch-2 spaces; (sc, ch 5, sc) in next ch-2 space; ch 7, skip next ch-2 space, skip next ch-3 space; (sc, ch 8, slip st into 8th ch from hook, sc) in next ch-2 space; ch 7, skip next ch-3 space, skip next ch-2 space; (sc, ch 5, sc) in next ch-2 space; ch 6, skip next 2 ch-2 spaces; (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-2 space; ch 5; *sc between the next 2 dc, ch 5; (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-2 space; ch 6, skip next 2 ch-2 spaces; (sc, ch 5, sc) in next ch-2 space; ch 7, skip next ch-2 space, skip next ch-3 space; (sc, ch 8, slip st into 8th ch from hook, sc) in next ch-2 space; ch 7, skip next ch-3 space, skip next ch-2 space; (sc, ch 5, sc) in next ch-2 space; ch 6, skip next 2 ch-2 spaces; (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-2 space; ch 5*; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into beginning sc – 8 ch-8 loops.
Round 20: Ch 1, sc in same sc, triple picot in last sc made, slip st around base of triple picot just made, sc in same sc; (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-5 space; sc in next ch-4 space, [ch 3, sc in same ch-4 space] 3 times; (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in next ch-6 space; (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 4, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-5 space; (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in next ch-7 space; (2 sc, ch 3, 4 sc, triple picot in last sc made, slip st around base of triple picot just made, 3 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in ch-8 loop; (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in next ch-7 space; (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 4, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-5 space; (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in next ch-6 space; sc in next ch-4 space, [ch 3, sc in same ch-4 space] 3 times; (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-5 space; *(sc, triple picot in last sc made, slip st around base of triple picot just made, sc) in next sc; (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-5 space; sc in next ch-4 space; [ch 3, sc in same space] 3 times; (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in next ch-6 space; (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 4, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-5 space; (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in next ch-7 space; (2 sc, ch 3, 4 sc, triple picot in last sc made, slip st around base of triple picot just made, 3 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in ch-8 loop; (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in next ch-7 space; (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 4, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-5 space; (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in next ch-6 space; sc in next ch-4 space, [ch 3, sc in same ch-4 space] 3 times; (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-5 space; repeat from * to * around, ending with a slip st into beginning sc – 16 triple picots
Fasten off. Weave ends in. Block.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.5 mm [US E-5]
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into specified stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: Rounds 1–7 = 4" [10 cm] diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, sc in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 3, sc in same ch] 5 times; join with ch 1, hdc in first sc (counts as last ch-3 space)—6 sc and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: Sc around post of joining hdc, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 5 times; join with ch 1, hdc in first sc.
Round 3: Sc around post of joining hdc, [ch 4, sc in next ch-3 space] 5 times; join with ch 2, hdc in first sc (counts as last ch-4 space)—6 sc and 6 ch-4 spaces.
Round 4: Sc around post of joining hdc, [ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-4 space] 5 times, ch 3, sc in next ch-4 space; join with ch 1, hdc in first sc—12 sc and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: Sc around post of joining hdc, [ch 4, sc in next ch-3 space] 11 times; join with ch 1, dc in first sc (counts as last ch-4 space)—12 sc and 12 ch-4 spaces.
Round 6: Sc around post of joining dc, [ch 5, sc in next ch-4 space] 11 times; join with ch 2, dc in first sc (counts as last ch-5 space)—12 sc and 12 ch-5 spaces.
Round 7: Sc around post of joining dc, [ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space] 11 times; join with ch 1, tr in first sc (counts as last ch-5 space).
Round 8: (Sc, ch 5, sc) around post of joining tr, [ch 4, (sc, ch 5, sc) in next ch-5 space] 11 times; join with ch 1, dc in first sc—24 sc, 12 ch-5 spaces and 12 ch-4 spaces.
Round 9: Sc around post of joining dc, ch 1, 5-dc shell in next ch-5 space, [ch 1, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 1, 5-dc shell in next ch-5 space] 11 times, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—Twelve 5-dc shells and 12 sc.
Round 10: Sc in next ch-1 space, picot, *[sc in next ch-1 space, picot] 4 times **, sc dec, picot; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; insert hook in last ch-1 space and draw up a loop, insert hook in first sc, yarn over and draw loop through all loops on hook—60 picots.
Round 11: Ch 1, working behind sts of Round 10 in 5-dc shells of Round 9, slip st in first dc of first 5-dc shell, [ch 1, sc in next dc] 3 times, ch 7, skip last dc of same shell, *skip first dc of next shell, sc in next dc, [ch 1, sc in next dc] twice, ch 7, skip last dc of same shell; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—12 ch-7 spaces and 36 sc.
Round 12: Slip st in next ch-1 space, sc in next sc, ch 1, 7-dc shell in next ch-7 space, [ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 1, 7-dc shell in next ch-7 space] 11 times, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—Twelve 7-dc shells and 12 sc.
Round 13: Sc in next ch-1 space, picot, *[sc in next ch-1 space, picot] 6 times **, sc dec, picot; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; insert hook in last ch-1 space and draw up a loop, insert hook in first sc, yarn over and draw loop through all loops on hook—84 picots.
Round 14: Ch 1, working behind sts of Round 13 in 7-dc shells of Round 12, slip st in first dc of first 7-dc shell, ch 1, slip st in next dc, [ch 1, sc in next dc] 3 times, ch 9, skip last 2 dc of same shell, *skip first 2 dc of next shell, sc in next dc of same shell, [ch 1, sc in next dc] twice, ch 9, skip last 2 dc of same shell; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—12 ch-9 spaces and 36 sc.
Round 15: Slip st in next ch-1 space, sc in next sc, ch 1, 9-dc shell in next ch-9 space, [ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 1, 9-dc shell in next ch-9 space] 11 times, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—Twelve 9-dc shells and 12 sc.
Round 16: Sc in next ch-1 space, picot, *[sc in next ch-1 space, picot] 8 times **, sc dec, picot; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; insert hook in last ch-1 space and draw up a loop, insert hook in first sc, yarn over and draw loop through all loops on hook—108 picots. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 1/2 Ounces 376 Burgundy CA
abbreviations: CA, CB, CC, etc. = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Placemat measures approximately 19” wide x 14” high, excluding fringe.
gauge: 17 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in pat. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: With CA, ch 95. Fasten off. Row 1 (Right Side): With CA, ch 7 for fringe, sc in 8 ch of foundation ch, * ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch; rep from * across until 7 ch remain on foundation ch; do not work these ch; ch 7 for fringe; turn. Fasten off. Row 2: With CA, ch 7 for fringe, sc in first sc, * ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next sc; rep from * across; ch 7 for fringe; turn. Fasten off. Rows 3-55: Rep Row 2 in the following color sequence: 2 rows CB 1 row CC 1 row CD 1 row CC 2 rows CE 1 row CA 1 row CB 1 row CA 2 rows CC 2 rows CB 3 rows CA 2 rows CB 1 row CD 1 row CC 1 row CD 2 rows CE 3 rows CA 2 rows CE 1 row CD 1 row CC 1 row CD 2 rows CB 3 rows CA 2 rows CB 2 rows CC 1 row CA 1 row CB 1 row CA 2 rows CE 1 row CC 1 row CD 1 row CC 2 rows CB 2 rows CA. FINISHING: Weave in ends OR pull end of yarn on fringe to make sure knot is tight against ch; trim end close to knot. If desired, secure knot with a drop of seam sealant to prevent raveling.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton (1.75 oz/50 g; 80 yds/73 m)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Utensil Holder: Approx 9" [23 cm] high. Pot Holder: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] square.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
UTENSIL HOLDER
Note: To change color, work to last  
2 loops on hook. Draw loop in next color 
through 2 loops on hook to complete st 
and proceed in next color.
With MC, ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to 
form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
*1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
*1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 
2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
*1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 
3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
*1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last  
4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to 
back loop of first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. Working through both 
loops, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in 
each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 6 times more.
**Next rnd: With B, as 9th rnd.
Next 3 rnds: With A, as 9th rnd.
Next rnd: With B, as 9th rnd.
Next 6 rnds: With MC, as 9th rnd.**
Rep from ** to ** once.
Next rnd: With MC, working from left to 
right, instead of from right to left as usual, 
work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Join MC with sl st to any front loop of 8th 
rnd. 
Next rnd: Working from left to right, instead 
of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse 
sc in each front loop around. Join with  
sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Make Daffodil (see page 2) and sew to 
Utensil Holder as illustrated in photograph.
 
POT HOLDER
With MC, ch 24.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
1 sc in each sc to end of row. 23 sc. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each 
sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row twice 
more, ending last row with join B by 
drawing through last 2 loops of sc. 
Next row: With B, as 2nd row. 
Next row: With MC, as 2nd row. 
Next row: With B, as 2nd row. 
Next 17 rows: With MC, as 2nd row. 
Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, join A with sl st to 
any corner. 
1st rnd: With A, ch 1. 3 sc in same st as 
last sl st. 1 sc in each st around working 3 
sc in corner sts. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, 
instead of from right to left as usual, work  
1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with  
sl st to first sc. Ch 10 (hanging loop). Join 
in rnd with sl st to first ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Beg with 6th st from left edge, with B 
embroider 2 rows of chain st, 1 st apart as 
illustrated. Sew on Daffodil at top corner 
under hanging loop as illustrated.
Daffodil
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Join with sl st in first sc. 
First Petal: 1st row: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc 
as last sl st. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc. 4 sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 6 sc. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.  
Turn. 
5th row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of 
next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on 
hook - Sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next  
2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 
6th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sts. Turn. 
7th row: Ch 3. Skip first sc. Sl st in next sc. 
Sl st in side of each of next 6 rows of Petal. 
Sl st in last sc worked on 1st row and in 
next sc. Do not turn.
Second to Sixth Petals: 1st row: Ch 1.  
2 sc in same sc as last sl st. Ch 1. Turn. 
2nd to 7th rows: Work as given for 2nd 
to 7th rows of First Petal. At end of Sixth 
Petal, fasten off.
Trumpet: With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join 
with sl st in first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 10 sc. 
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook.  
(1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from 
hook) 9 times. Join with sl st in next sc. 
Fasten off.

abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: GAUGE: Rnds 1-5 = 4 1/4” across; Rnds 1-23 = 20” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Rnd 1: Ch 5, [dc in 5th ch from hook, ch 1] 7 times; join with a sl st in 4th ch of ch-5.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, tr around post of st directly below, dc in top of same st, ch 1, [dc in next dc, tr around post of same dc, dc in same dc, ch 1] 7 times; join in top of ch-3.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, [sc in st, 2 sc around post of next tr, sc in next st, 2 sc in ch-1 sp] 8 times; join in first sc – 48 sc.
Rnd 4: Ch 6, skip first 3 sc, [dc in next sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc] 15 times; join in 3rd ch of ch-6.
Rnd 5: Ch 5, sc in sp, ch 2, [dc in next dc, ch 2, sc in sp, ch 2] 15 times; join in 3rd ch of ch-5.
Rnd 6: Ch 8, [dc in next dc, ch 5] 15 times; join in 3rd ch of ch-8.
Rnd 7: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, * [ch 1, dtr] 8 times all in next dc, ch 1 **, sc in next dc; rep from * around, end at **; join. 
Rnd 8: Sl st across to 2nd ch-1 sp, ch 1, sc in same sp, * [ch 3, sc in next sp] 6 times, ch 1, skip next 2 sps **, sc in next sp; rep from * around, end at **; join.
Rnd 9: (Sl st, ch 1, sc) all in ch-3 sp – beg rnd made; ch 3, * sc in ch-3 sp, ch 3; rep from * around; join.
Rnd 10: Beg rnd, * [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 sp] 4 times, ch 5, skip next ch-3 sp **, sc in next ch-3 sp; rep from * around, end at **; join.
Rnd 11: Beg rnd, * [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 sp] 3 times, ch 8 **, sc in next ch-3 sp; rep from * around, end at **; join.
Rnd 12: Beg rnd, * [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 sp] twice, ch 12 **, sc in next ch-3 sp; rep from * around, end at **; join.
Rnd 13: Beg rnd, * ch 3, sc in ch-3 sp, ch 16 **, sc in ch-3 sp; rep from * around, end at **; join.
Rnd 14: Beg rnd, * ch 10, sc around the ch-lps of last 3 rnds (ch-8, ch-12, ch-16) together, ch 10 **, sc in next ch-3 sp; rep from * around, end at **; join.
Rnd 15: Ch 4, * [dc, ch 1] 5 times all in ch-10 sp **, dc in next sc, ch 1; rep from * around, end at **; join in 3rd ch of ch-4.
Rnd 16: Ch 5, * sc in next dc, ch 2 **, dc in next dc, ch 2; rep from * around, end at **; join in 3rd ch of ch-5.
Rnd 17: Ch 7, * dc in next dc, ch 4; rep from * around; join in 3rd ch of ch-7.
Rnd 18: Ch 1, (sc, ch 3, tr) all in same st as joining, * (sc, ch 3, tr) all in next dc; rep from * around; join.
Rnd 19: Ch 8, * dc in next sc, ch 5; rep from * around; join in 3rd ch of ch-8.
Rnd 20: Ch 3, * tr in sp, ch 3, dc around post of tr just made **, dc in next dc; rep from * around, end at **; join in top of ch-3.
Rnd 21: Ch 9, * skip next dc, dc in next dc, ch 6; rep from * around; join in 3rd ch of ch-9.
Rnd 22: Ch 3, 2 dc in same st as joining, * ch 2, sc in sp, ch 2 **, 3 dc in next dc; rep from * around, end at **; join.
Rnd 23: Sl st to first sc, ch 9, * dc in next sc, ch 6; rep from * around; join in 3rd ch of ch-9.
Rnd 24: Ch 4, * [dc, ch 1] 3 times all in sp **, dc in next dc, ch 1; rep from * around, end at **; join in 3rd ch of ch-4.
Rnd 25: Ch 3, tr around post of st directly below, dc in same st, * ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc, tr around post of same dc, dc in same dc; rep from * around; sc in top of ch-3 to join and form last sp.
Rnd 26: Ch 7, * sc in next sp, ch 4 **, dc in next sp, ch 4; rep from * around, end at **; join in 3rd ch of ch-7.
Rnd 27: Ch 5, 2 dc in same st as joining, * ch 2, 8 dtr in next dc, ch 2 **; (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in next dc – shell made; rep from * around, end at **; dc in same st as joining; join in 3rd ch of ch-5.
Rnd 28: (Sl st, ch 5, 2 dc) all in ch-2 sp, * ch 2, [dc in next dtr, ch 1] 7 times, dc in next dtr, ch 2, skip next sp **, shell in next sp; rep from * around, end at **; dc in same sp as joining; join in 3rd ch of ch-5.
Rnd 29: (Sl st, ch 5, shell) all in ch-2 sp, * ch 2, skip ch-2 sp, sc in ch-1 sp, [ch 3, sc in ch-1 sp] 6 times, ch 2, skip ch-2 sp **, (2 dc, ch 2, shell) all in next ch-2 sp; rep from * around, end at **; (2 dc, ch 2) in same sp as joining; join in 3rd ch of ch-5.
Shape Tips-Row 30: (Sl st, ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in ch-2 sp, ch 2, sc in ch-3 sp, [ch 3, sc in ch-3 sp] 5 times, ch 2, skip ch-2 sp, shell in next ch-2 sp; TURN.
Row 31: Sl st to sp, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in sp – beg shell made; ch 2, sc in ch-3 sp, [ch 3, sc in ch-3 sp] 4 times, ch 2; shell in ch-2 sp of shell – shell over shell made; turn.
Row 32: Beg shell, ch 2, sc in ch-3 sp, [ch 3, sc in ch-3 sp] 3 times, ch 2, shell over shell; turn.
Row 33: Beg shell, ch 2, sc in ch-3 sp, [ch 3, sc in ch-3 sp] twice, ch 2, shell over shell; turn.
Row 34: Beg shell, ch 2, sc in ch-3 sp, ch 3, sc in ch-3 sp, ch 2, shell over shell; turn.
Row 35: Beg shell, ch 2, sc in ch-3 sp, ch 2, shell over shell; turn.
Row 36: Sl st to sp, ch 2, holding back last lp on hook, dc in same sp, 2 dc in sp of last shell, yo and through all 4 lps on hook. Fasten off.
*** With right side facing, attach yarn in next ch-2 sp of Rnd 29; rep Rows 30-36. Rep from *** around.

materials: Color A - #00095 Red ½ oz [14 g]; 24 yds [22 m] or 1 ball
Color B - #00001 White ¾ oz [16 g]; 28 yds [25 m] or 1 ball
Color C - #00009 Bright Navy ½ oz [14 g]; 24 yds [22 m] or 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx. 1¾ ins [4.5 cm] diameter for rings.
gauge: 13 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
RING (make 2 each with A and C)
Ch 24. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures approx 1¾ ins [4.5 cm]. Fasten off.

STAR (Make 4 with B)
Base: Ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. 20 sc. Join with sl st in first sc.
First Point: *Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made) twice. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. Sl st along side of Point to Base.
Rep from * 4 times more. 5 Points in total.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew in all ends. Sew one Star to each Napkin Ring.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 313 Aran A, 334 Buff B, and 320 Cornmeal C.
abbreviations: Ldc = Work dc over ch-1 space into st two rows below.
gauge: 12 sc = 4”; rows 1-3 in pattern = 1¼” CHECK YOUR GAUGE: Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 34.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 33 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 1, skip 1 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across; change to C.
Row 3: With C, ch 1, sc in first sc, * Ldc over next ch-1 space into sc 2 rows below, sc in next sc; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 1, skip next Ldc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn – 33 sc.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2, changing to B in last st.
Row 7: With B, repeat Row 3.
Row 8: Repeat Row 4.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first sc, skip next space, * shell in next sc, skip next space, sc in next sc, skip next space; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 10: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in 1st sc, * sc in center dc of next shell, ch 1, dc in next sc, ch 1; repeat from * across to last shell; sc in center dc of last shell, 2 dc in last sc; turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn – 33 sc.
Row 12: Repeat Row 2, changing to A in last st.
Rows 13-16: With A, repeat Rows 3-6; change to C in last st of Row 16.
Rows 17-20: With C, repeat Rows 3-6; change to B in last st of Row 20.
Rows 21-26: With B, repeat Rows 7-12; DO NOT change color at end; fasten off.
With Right Side facing, attach A in unused loop of beginning ch; ch 1, sc in same ch and in each ch across; turn.
Repeat Rows 2-26.
BORDER: With Right Side facing, attach A in beginning ch on long side edge; ch 1.
Rnd 1: Sc in same ch and in end of each row to corner; (sc, ch 2,sc) in end sc – corner made, * Ldc over next ch-1 space into sc 2 rows below, sc in next sc; repeat from * across short side; corner in end sc, sc in end of each row down long side; corner in end sc; repeat from * across 2nd short side; corner, sc in end of remaining rows of 2nd long side. Join with a slip st to beginning sc; turn – 53 sc on each long side.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, sc in next sc, ch 1, * skip next st, sc in next st, ch 1; repeat from * to ch-2 space, corner in ch-2 space **; repeat from * to ** around placemat; join; turn.
Rnd 3: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 3 (counts as 1st dc of shell), 2 dc in same space, sc in next ch-1 space, * shell in next ch-1 space, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to corner, 5 dc in corner ch-2 space, sc in next ch-1 space **; repeat from * to ** around mat; join to top of beginning ch-3; fasten off.
Rnd 4: With Right Side facing, attach C in any sc near center of any side, ch 1, sc in same st, * ch 1, (sc, ch 2,sc) in center dc of shell, ch 1, sc in next sc; repeat from * to corner; ch 1, skip 1 dc, corner in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next sc **; repeat from * to ** around placemat; join to last ch-1 to beginning sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in ends.

abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Hearts Desire 
Motif
One basic motif that makes it easy to create 
to your Hearts Desire. Change the overall 
size by simply changing the weight of thread 
you choose.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, * dc 
in next 5 dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 2, sc in ch-4 
space, ch 2 **, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * 
around, end at **; join.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, * (dc, ch 4, dc) 
all in next dc, dc in next 4 dc, ch 4 **, dc in 
next 4 dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, * ch 4, sc in 
next ch-4 space, ch 4, dc in next 5 dc, ch 2, 
sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2 **, dc in next 5 dc; 
repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 8: Ch 2, beg 5-dc-cl, * [ch 5, sc in next 
ch-4 loop] twice, ch 5, 5-dc-cl, ch 7 **; 5-dc-
cl; repeat from * around, end at **; join to top 
of first cl.
Round 9: Ch 1, (3 sc, picot, 3 sc) all in ch-5 
loop, * [(3 sc, picot, 3 sc) all in next loop] 
twice, (4 sc, picot, 4 sc) all in next ch-7 loop 
**, (3 sc, picot, 3 sc) all in next ch-5 loop; 
repeat from * around, end at **; join to first sc. 
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Special Abbreviations
beg cl (beginning cl) = [yo and draw up a 
loop, yo and draw through 2 loops] twice all in 
ring, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
cl (cluster) = [yo and draw up a loop, yo and 
draw through 2 loops] 3 times all in ring, yo 
and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
beg 5-dc-cl (worked over next 4 sts) = [yo 
and draw up a loop in next dc, yo and draw 
through 2 loops] 4 times, yo and draw through 
all 5 loops on hook.
5-dc-cl (worked over next 5 sts) = [yo and
draw up a loop in next dc, yo and draw 
through 2 loops] 5 times, yo and draw through 
all 6 loops on hook.
picot = ch 3, slip st in top and side loops of sc.
DOILY
Ch 7; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 2, beg cl, ch 4, [cl, ch 4] 5 times; 
join with a slip st to top of beg cl.
Round 2: Slip st in first 2 ch of ch-4, slip st 
into ch-space, ch 3, 2 dc in same space, ch 4, 
[3 dc in next ch-4 space, ch 4] 5 times; join to 
top of ch-3.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, * dc 
in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 2, sc in ch-4 
space, ch 2 **, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * 
around, end at **; join.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, * dc 
in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 4 **, 2 dc in 
next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Bright Navy (00009) or Jute (00082) or Tangerine (01699) 2 balls or 155 yds/142 m
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times in next stitch. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.

Hot Pad Squares (make 2)
Ch 22.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 21 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 8 times more. Fasten off.
Joining Squares and Working Border
Place one Square on top of the other with WS facing and align. Join yarn with sl st to any corner. Working through both thicknesses of Hot Pad for joining rnd, proceed as follows:
1st rnd (joining rnd):  Ch 2. (3 dc in corner. Work 1 dc in each of next 21 sts. 3 dc in corner. PM on center st. Work 21 dc evenly along edge to next corner) twice. Join with sl st to first dc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 2. Working 1 st around each unmarked st and 3 sts around each marked st, work in alt (Dcfp. Dcbp) ribbing, working 3 sts around each marked st. PM on center st. Join with sl st to first dc.
3rd rnd: As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.
YouTube video: https://youtu.be/tgQN8WzIZ7s

materials: RED HEART® 'Soft Yarn': 1 Ball each 4608 Wine A and 9523 Dark Leaf B.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Napkin Ring is 6” around. Hearts measure 2½” at widest part x 2” long.
gauge: 17 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEART (Make 2)
With A, ch 11.
Round 1: 3 Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; pivot to work in unused loops of beginning ch, sc in next 3 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 3 ch – 20 sc. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Mark first st of round and move up each round.
Round 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 2 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 2 sc, [2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 4 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 4 sc – 26 sc.
Round 3: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 2 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 4 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 5 sc; slip st in next sc – 32 sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
RING
With B, ch 25, join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring taking care that ch is not twisted.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with a slip st in first sc – 25 sc. Fasten off.
TIE
With B, ch 40. Fasten off.
Finishing
Make Tie chain into a bow; sew to middle of Ring. Attach a Heart to each end of Tie. Weave in all ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Extra Fine Crochet Thread, Size 30: 1 ball 201 White
abbreviations: beg cl (beginning cluster) = ch 2; holding the last loop of each st on the hook, fpdc around next fpdc, dc in next dc, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
ch-4 picot = ch 4, slip st in top of last st made.
cl (cluster) = holding the last loop of each st on the hook, dc in next dc, fpdc around next fpdc, dc in next dc, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.

edc (extended double crochet) = yarn over, insert hook in stitch or space indicated, yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 1 loop on hook (3 loops on hook), [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice.

fpdc (front post double crochet) = yarn over, insert hook from the front side of the work to back and to front again around the post of the indicated stitch on a previous round; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through two loops (2 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through two loops (1 loop on hook).
triple picot = [ch 4, slip st in 4th chain from hook] 3 times.
gauge: Rounds 1–9 measure 3” (7.5 cm) in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DOILY
Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 2 (counts as first dc now and throughout), 15 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—16 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc, ch 1), * dc in next dc, ch 1; repeat from * around; join with slip st in second ch of beginning ch-3.
Round 3: Ch 2, fpdc around same st; reaching behind fpdc just made, dc in top of same st; * ch 1, dc in next dc, fpdc around same dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around; slip st in second ch of beginning ch-2.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same space, * ch 4, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; ch 1, d...
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same space, * ch 5, sc in next ch-4 space; repeat from * around; ch 2, d...
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in same space, * 5 dc in next sc, (fan made), sc in next ch-5 space, ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around; ch 2, d...
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in same space, ch 6, sc in 3rd dc of next fan, * ch 6, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 6, sc in 3rd dc of next fan; repeat from * around; ch 2, edc in first sc of Round (counts as a ch-6 space).
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in same space, * 7 dc in next sc (fan made), sc in next ch-6 space, ch 7, sc in next ch-6 space; repeat from * around; ch 3, edc in first sc of Round (counts as a ch-7 space).
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in same space, ch 8, sc in 4th dc of next fan, * ch 8, sc in next ch-7 space, ch 8, sc in 4th dc of next fan; repeat from * around; ch 8, slip st in first sc of Round.
Round 10: Slip st into first 2 chs of ch-8 space, ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 2), dc in same space, ch 2, dc in same space, ch 2, * dc in next ch-8 space [ch 2, dc in same space] twice, ch 2; repeat from * around; slip st in second ch of beginning ch-4.
Round 11: Ch 2, fpdc around same st, dc in same st, ch 1, * dc in next dc, fpdc around same dc, dc in same dc, ch 1; repeat from * around; slip st in second ch of beginning ch-2.
Round 12: Ch 2, fpdc around next fpdc, dc in next dc, ch 1, * dc in next dc, fpdc around next fpdc, dc in next dc, ch 1; repeat from * around; slip st in second ch of beginning ch-2.
Round 13: Beg cl, ch 3, * cl, ch 3; repeat from * around; slip st in top of beg cl.
Round 14: Slip st in ch-3 space, ch 1, 4 sc in same space, 4 sc in next ch-3 space, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, ch 12, slip st in 7th ch from hook, ch 6, 2 sc in same space, * [4 sc in next ch-3 space] twice, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, ch 12, slip st in 7th ch from hook, ch 6, 2 sc in same space; repeat from * around; slip st in back loop of first sc of Round.
Round 15: Work in back loop only of each sc around.
Point 1
Ch 1, sc in same sc, sc in next 3 sc, ch 3, sc in next 5 sc, sk next sc, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch 4 picot, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 3 dc, ch-4 picot, [4 dc, ch-4 picot] twice, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch-4 picot, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, skip next sc, sc in next 5 sc.
Points 2-15
Ch 3, sc in next 5 sc, skip next sc, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, slip st into last picot on previous Point, ch 2, slip st in top of last tr made, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 3 dc, ch-4 picot, [4 dc, ch-4 picot] twice, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch-4 picot, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, skip next sc, sc in next 5 sc.
Point 16
Ch 3, sc in next 5 sc, skip next sc, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, slip st into last picot on previous Point, ch 2, slip st in top of last tr made, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 3 dc, ch-4 picot, [4 dc, ch-4 picot] twice, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, slip st into first picot on first Point at beginning of Round, ch 2, slip st in top of last tr made, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, skip next sc, sc in next sc, slip st in first sc at beginning of Round. Fasten off, weave ends in.
Round 16: Attach thread in the ch-4 picot on the top of any Point, ch 1, sc in same st, ch 15, * sc in next ch-4 picot on top of next Point, ch 15; repeat from * around; slip st in first sc of Round.
Round 17: Ch 1, sc in same st, 4 sc in next ch-15 space, triple picot, 8 sc in same space, triple picot, 3 sc in same space, * sc in next sc, 4 sc in next space, triple picot, 8 sc in same space, triple picot, 3 sc in same space; repeat from * around; slip st in first sc of Round.
Round 18: Ch 1, sc in same st, ch 12, * skip (4 sc, triple picot, 3 sc), sc in next sc, ch 12; repeat from * around; slip st in first sc of Round.
Round 19: Slip st into ch-12 space, ch 1, 3 sc in same space, ch 3, 5 sc in same space, ch 3, 3 sc in same space, * 3 sc in next ch-12 space, ch 3, 5 sc in same space, ch 3, 3 sc in same space; repeat from * around; slip st in first sc of Round.
Round 20: Slip st across (2 sc, ch-3 space, 2 sc), ch 4, skip next sc, dc in next sc, ch 8, * skip (sc, ch-3, 6 sc, ch-3, sc), dc in next sc, ch 2, skip next sc, dc in next sc, ch 8; repeat from * around; slip st in second ch of beginning ch-4.
Round 21: Ch 5, dc in next dc, ch 3, dc in ch-8 space, ch 3, * dc in next dc, ch 3, dc in next dc, ch 3, dc in next ch-8 space, ch 3; repeat from * around; slip st in second ch of beginning ch-5.
Round 22: Ch 2, fpdc around same st, dc in same st, ch 1, * dc in next dc, fpdc around same dc, dc in same dc, ch 1; repeat from * around; slip st in second ch of beginning ch-2.
Round 23: Ch 2, fpdc around next fpdc, dc in next dc, ch 1, * dc in next dc, fpdc around next fpdc, dc in next dc, ch 1; repeat from * around; slip st in second ch of beginning ch-2.
Round 24: Beg cl, * ch 3, cl; repeat from * around; edc in top of first cluster at beginning of Round (counts as a ch-3 space).
Round 25: Ch 1, 3 sc in same space, 4 sc in next ch-3 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, sc in top of next cluster, ch 12, slip st in the 7th ch from hook, ch 6, sc in same st, * 3 sc in next ch-3 space, 4 sc in next ch-3 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, sc in top of next cluster, ch 12, slip st in the 7th ch from hook, ch 6, sc in same st; repeat from * around; slip st in back loop of first sc of Round.
Round 26: Work in back loop only of each sc around.
Point 1
Ch 1, sc in next 5 sc, ch 3, sc in next 5 sc, skip next sc, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch-4 picot, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 3 dc, ch-4 picot, 4 dc, triple picot, 4 dc, ch-4 picot, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch-4 picot, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, skip next sc, sc in next 5 sc.
Points 2-31
Ch 3, sc in next 5 sc, skip next sc, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, slip st into last picot on previous Point, ch 2, slip st in top of last tr made, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 3 dc, ch-4 picot, 4 dc, triple picot, 4 dc, ch-4 picot, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch-4 picot, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, skip next sc, sc in next 5 sc.
Point 32
Ch 3, sc in next 5 sc, skip next sc, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, slip st into last picot on previous Point, ch 2, slip st in top of last tr made, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 3 dc, ch-4 picot, 4 dc, triple picot, 4 dc, ch-4 picot, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, (sc, hdc, 2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, slip st into first picot on first Point at beginning of Round, ch 2, slip st in top of last tr made, tr, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, skip next sc, sc in next sc, slip st in first sc at beginning of Round. Fasten off, weave ends in. Block doily to size.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 275 Coral
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: small flower = about 1½” [4 cm] diameter; small leaf = about 1 x 1½” [2.5 x 4 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CENTER FLOWER
Ch 6; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), dc in ring, [ch 3, dc in ring] 4 times, ch 3; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—6 dc and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: (Sc, hdc, 3 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-3 space around; do not join—6 petals.
Round 3: Working behind petals, slip st around post of first dc of Round 1, *ch 5, slip st around post of next dc in Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 5; join with slip st in first slip st—6 ch-5 spaces.
Round 4: (Sc, hdc, 4 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-5 space around; do not join—6 petals.
Round 5: Working behind petals, slip st around first dc in Round 1, *ch 7, slip st around post of next dc in Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 7; join with slip st in first slip st—6 ch-7 spaces.
Round 6: (Sc, hdc, 7 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-7 space around; join with slip st in first sc—6 petals.
Fasten off.

SMALL LEAF (make 6)
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (does not count as a st), 10 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc to join—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as tr), (tr, dc) in same st as joining, 2 hdc in next st, 2 sc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, (2 dc, tr) in next st, picot, (tr, 2 dc) in next st, 2 hdc in next st, 2 sc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, (dc, 2 tr) in next st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 sts and 1 picot.
Fasten off.

LACE LEAF I (make 6)
Ch 14; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 23 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—23 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, [ch 3, skip next st, hdc in next st] 4 times, ch 3, skip next st, dc in next st, ch 3, skip next st, (tr, ch 6, tr) in next st, ch 3, skip next st, dc in next st, [ch 3, skip next st, hdc in next st] 4 times, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—13 sts, 12 ch-3 spaces, and 1 ch-6 space. Do not fasten off.
Round 3: Ch 16 (for stem), sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 14 ch, 4 sc in each of first 6 ch-3 spaces, (4 sc, ch 2, 4 sc) in next ch-6 space, 4 sc in each of next 6 ch-3 spaces; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

SINGLE STEM (make 6)
Ch 28.
Row 1 (RS): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch, puff in next st, sc in next 16 ch – 26 sc and 3 puffs.

SHORT ROW LEAF (make 12)
Ch 9.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 3rd ch from hook (2 skipped ch count as beginning ch-2 space) and in next 5 ch, (sc, 3 hdc, sc) in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 6 ch, 3 sc in beginning ch-2 space; do not join—20 sts.
Row 2: Do not turn, sc in next 5 sc; leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in first 6 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts; leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in first 7 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts; leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in first 6 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts.
Fasten off.

LACE LEAF II (make 12)
Ch 14; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of Lace Leaf I. Do not fasten off.
Round 3: Ch 7 (for stem), sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 ch, 4 sc in first 6 ch-3 spaces, (4 sc, ch 2, 4 sc) in next ch-6 space, 4 sc in each of next 6 ch-3 spaces; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

SMALL FLOWER (make 12)
Ch 6; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rounds 1–4: Work same as Rounds 1–4 of Center Flower; join end of Round 4 with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

ASSEMBLY
Arrange pieces following Assembly Diagram. Whipstitch pieces together. Sew just a few stitches where the pieces touch and carefully weave in ends.

BORDER
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join thread with sc in center st of top petal of any Small Flower, ch 20, sc in st near middle of side edge of next Lace Leaf II, *ch 20, sc in center st of top petal of next Small Flower, ch 20, sc in st near middle of side edge of next Lace Leaf II; repeat from * around, ch 20; join with slip st in first sc—24 ch-20 spaces and 24 sc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 27 dc in first ch-20 space, *dc in next sc, 27 dc in next ch-20 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—672 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc), (dc, picot, 2 dc) in same st as joining, *ch 1, skip next 6 sts, (2 dc, picot, 2 dc) in next st; repeat from * to last 6 sts, ch 1, skip next 6 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—96 picot.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in any remaining ends. Block. Apply fabric stiffener following instructions on container. Pin out doily and allow to dry.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Ecru (00004) 2 balls or 219 yds/200 m
Contrast B Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast C Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast D Sage Green (00084) 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast E Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] long x 12" [30.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
With A, ch 58.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. (1 hdc in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next ch) 4 times. 1 hdc in each of next 38 ch. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 hdc in next ch) 4 times. 1 hdc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. (1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1) 4 times. 1 hdc in each of next 38 hdc. (Ch 1. 1 hdc in next hdc) 4 times. 1 hdc in last hdc. Break A. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. (1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1) 4 times. 1 hdc in each of next 38 hdc. (Ch 1. 1 hdc in next hdc) 4 times. 1 hdc in last hdc. Break B. Join A. Turn.
4th row: With A, as 3rd row. Break A, join C.
5th row: With C, as 3rd row. Break C. Join A.
6th row: With A, as 3rd row. Break A, join D.
7th row: With D, as 3rd row. Break D, join A.
8th row: With A, as 3rd row. Break A, Join E.
9th row: With E, as 3rd row. Break E. Join A.
With A only, rep 3rd row until piece measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], join E at end of last row.
Cont in pat, working 1 row each in following sequence: E, A, D, A, C, A, B, A.
Next row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc and ch-1 sp across. Fasten off.
Vertical Surface Sl St Lines:
With RS facing, join B with sl st to center first ch-1 sp at foundation row at back. Keeping yarn at back (WS) of work, sl st into each ch-1 sp in alternate rows above joining sp to create a straight vertical line of surface sl sts to top of Placemat, taking care to sl st loosely to avoid pulling in work as you stitch. Fasten off.
Rep Vertical Sl St Line in following sequence: C, D, E. Turn Placemat and rep for opposite side edge.
FINISHING
With RS facing, join E with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around each side edge, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic Crochet size 10: 2 Balls 001 White or 805 Blue Hawaii.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: Motif = 3” x 3” square. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
FIRST MOTIF: Ch 20.
Row 1: Dc in 8th ch from hook, [ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in next ch] 4 times; turn – 5 spaces.
Rows 2-4: Ch 5, skip first dc, [dc in next dc, ch 2, skip 2 ch] 4 times, dc in 3rd ch of ch-5; turn.
Row 5: Ch 5, skip first dc, [dc in next dc, ch 2, skip 2 ch] 3 times, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next 2 ch, tr in 3rd ch of ch-5 to form last space. 
Now work in rounds as follows: 
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc over tr, * sc in next st, 2 sc in next space, sc in next st, sc in next space; [ch 5, sc in 5th ch from hook – picot made] 5 times; sc in sc made in space, sc in same space, sc in next st, 2 sc in next space, sc in next st **, 7 sc in next corner space; repeat from * around, end at **; sc in next space; join with a slip st to first sc.
Round 2: Slip st in next 4 sc, * ch 7, skip next picot, sc in next picot, ch 11 for corner, skip next picot, sc in next picot, ch 7, skip next picot, skip next 6 sc **, slip st in next 5 sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join with a slip st to first slip st. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
SECOND MOTIF: Work same as for First Motif until Round 1 has been completed. When working the joining, insert the hook from the wrong side into the appropriate loop on finished motif. Motifs are joined with slip sts in 4 corresponding loops along each side. Where corners meet, join corner loops by working the slip st into the slip st of a previous joining.
Round 2-Joining Round: Slip st in next 4 sc, ch 7, skip next picot, sc in next picot, ch 5, slip st in any ch-11 loop on First Motif, ch 5, skip next picot on 2nd Motif, sc in next picot, ch 3, slip st in next ch-7 loop on First Motif, ch 3, skip next picot and next 6 sc on 2nd Motif, slip st in next 5 sc, ch 3, slip st in next ch-7 loop on First Motif, ch 3, skip next picot on 2nd Motif, sc in next picot, ch 5, slip st in next ch-11 loop on First Motif, ch 5, skip next picot on 2nd Motif, sc in next picot, ch 7, skip next picot and next 6 sc on 2nd Motif, slip st in next 5 sc; complete same as for First Motif begin at *.
Join 4 strips of 10 squares, joining on 2 sides where required after the first strip.
EDGING-Round 1: With right side facing, join thread in corner loop; ch 1, sc in corner loop, * ch 5, sc in next loop, ch 5, skip next 2 slip sts, dc in next slip st, [ch 5, sc in next loop] twice **, ch 2, dc in joining, ch 2, sc in next loop; repeat from * to next corner loop, end at **; work 4 more sc in corner loop; repeat from * around; join with a slip st to first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, * [5 sc in next ch-5 loop, sc in next st] 4 times **, 2 sc in next ch-2 loop, sc in next dc, 2 sc in next ch-2 loop, sc in next sc; repeat from * to corner, end at **; sc in next sc, 3 sc in next sc ***, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * around, end at ***; sc in last sc; join to first sc.
Round 3: Slip st in next 2 sc, ch 3, dc in next 2 sc, * ch 5, skip next 3 sc **, dc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to corner, end at **; dc in next sc, 3 dc in next sc, dc in next sc; repeat from * around; ch 2, tr in top of ch-3 to join and form last loop.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc over tr, * skip next dc, 3 tr in next dc, skip next dc, sc in next ch-5 loop; repeat from * to corner; skip next dc, [3 tr in next dc] 3 times, skip next dc **, sc in next ch-5 loop; repeat from * around, end at **; join to first sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, * ch 1, skip next tr; (2 dc, ch 3, slip st in top of last dc, dc) all in next tr – group made; ch 1, skip next tr, sc in next sc; repeat from * to corner; ch 1, skip next tr, [group in next tr, skip next tr] 4 times, ch 1 **, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 194 yds/177 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ [6.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Hot glue gun and glue sticks.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Approx 7½" [18 cm] in diameter x 4½" [11.5 cm] tall when stuffed.
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note:  Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral, placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting. See diagrams on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around.  12 sc. 
3rd rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 
10th and 11th rnds: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 dcfp around each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around.
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Skip next 2 dcfp. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Working in front of last 2 dcfp worked,  1 dcfp around each of 2 skipped dcfp. Rep from * around. 
13th to 15th rnds: As 10th rnd. 
16th to 23rd rnds:  Rep 12th to 15th rnds twice more. 
24th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Skip next 4 dcfp. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
Note: Stuff Pumpkin before working final rnd. Gently compress 1st rnd to 24th rnd to flatten into Pumpkin shape. 
25th rnd:  *1 sc in first sc. Skip next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 4 sc. Fasten off, leaving a 36" [91.5 cm] tail. Thread yarn needle with tail. Insert yarn needle through sc from 25th rnd of Pumpkin, exiting at center bottom. Insert yarn needle through next sc from 25th rnd, centering looped strand over 4 sc section and drawing taut to form wedge. Compress first and last rnds tog to flatten Pumpkin. Repeat this downward motion, making 6 lines of yarn around outside of Pumpkin as shown in Photo, placing strands in center of each 4-sc group. With hot glue gun, secure cinnamon stick into center of final rnd, ensuring it is securely inserted into Pumpkin.

abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: Placemat Rnd 1 = 6¼” long x 1¼” wide. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A ch 25.
Rnd 1: 4 Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 20 ch, 5 dc in last ch, working on opposite side of beg ch, dc in next 20 st; join with a slip st to top of ch-3 – 50 sts.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, [2 dc in next dc] 4 times, dc in next 20 dc, [2 dc in next dc] 5 times, dc in next 20 dc; join – 60 sts.
Rnd 3: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, [2 dc in next dc] 9 times, dc in next 20 dc, [2 dc in next dc] 10 times, dc in next 20 dc; join – 80 sts.
Rnd 4: Ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in same ch as joining, skip next dc, * (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st to first sc.
Rnd 5: Slip st into space, ch 1, * (sc, ch 4, sc) all in space; repeat from * around; join.
Rnds 6 and 7: Repeat Rnd 5.
Rnd 8: Slip st into space, ch 1, 3 sc in space, * [ch 2, 3 sc in next space] 9 times, ch 2, [2 sc in next space] 10 times, ch 2 **, 3 sc in next space; repeat from * to **; join.
Rnd 9: Ch 3, skip first sc, dc in next 2 sc, * [3 dc in next space, dc in next 3 sc] 9 times, 3 dc in next space, dc in next 20 sc, 3 dc in next space **, dc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to **; join.
Rnds 10 and 11: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join.
Rnd 12: Ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in same ch, skip next dc, * (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join to first sc.
Rnds 13-15: Repeat Rnd 5. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® With Love™ Metallic (4.5 oz/127 g; 200 yds/183 m) White (8010) 3 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: 2-dc Cl (2 double crochet cluster) = Yoh and draw up a loop in indicated st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw up a loop in same sp. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] wide x 60" [152.5 cm] long.
gauge: 12 dc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
RUNNER
Ch 45. 
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc) and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 43 dc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sl st in each dc to end of row. Turn
3rd row: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 4. 2-dc Cl) in first sl st. Skip next 2 sl sts. *(1 sc. Ch 4. 2-dc Cl) in first sl st. Skip next 2 sl sts. Rep from * to last sl st. 1 sc in last sl st. Turn. 14 ch-4 sps.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 43 dc.
6th to 117th rows: Rep last 4 rows 28 times more. Do not turn at end of last row.
EDGING
1st rnd:  (RS). Ch 1, working in ends of rows, in opposite side of foundation ch and across last row, sc evenly spaced around. Join with sl st in first sc. Do not turn. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays™ (2.8 oz/80 g; 138 yds/126 m) Christmas Red (47707) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 36.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 sc. Rep last row until work from beg measures 17" [43 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/71 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A Jute (00082)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Toast and Egg - Approx 5½" x 6" [14 x 15 cm]. Coffee Cup - Approx 4½" x 6" [11.5 x 15 cm]. Cherry Pie - Approx 6¾" [17 cm] diameter.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
CHERRY PIE Filling With E, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 7 sc. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 8 sc. 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc. Fasten off. Crust Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. With A, ch 4.
1st rnd: [1 dc. (Ch 1. 2 dc) 5 times. Ch 1] all in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 18 sts.
2nd rnd: Sl st across to first ch-1 sp. (Ch 3. 2 dc. Ch 1) in same ch-1 sp. *(3 dc. Ch 1) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Sl st across to first ch-1 sp. (Ch 3. 2 dc. Ch 1) in same ch-1 sp. *(3 dc. Ch 1) twice in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to first ch-1 sp. (3 dc. Ch 1) in first ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Sl st across to first ch-1 sp. (Ch 3. 2 dc. Ch 1) in same ch-1 sp. *(3 dc. Ch 1) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd: Sl st across to first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 sc in same ch-1 sp. *1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 2 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 sc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc. Place Filling behind Crust with RS facing up for both pieces.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around to join pieces. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 75 sc.
8th rnd: Skip first 3 sc. *5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in next st. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. Do not fasten off. Hanging loop: Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off, overlap end of loop and secure.
TOAST AND EGG Toast Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. With A, ch 20.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 18 dc.
2nd to 9th rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Skip first 3 sts. 7 tr in next dc. Skip next 3 sc. Sl st in each of next 3 dc. Skip next 3 dc. 7 tr in next dc. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st in last st. Fasten off. Crust: With RS facing, join B with sl st to bottom right corner of Toast. Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each rem ch of foundation ch across bottom edge. Work 3 sc in corner. Work 21 sc up side to center st of first 7 tr group. Work 3 sc in center st of 7 tr group. Work 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Work 3 sc in center st of 7 tr group. Work 21 sc down side. Work 2 sc in same corner as first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Egg Yolk With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: Work 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. Fasten off. Egg White With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: Work 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: (Skip next 2 sc. 7 tr in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc) 3 times. Fasten off. Sew Egg Yolk to Egg White and sew onto Toast as shown in photo.
Hanging Loop: Join B with sl st at top corner of Toast. Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off, overlap end of loop and secure.
COFFEE CUP Coffee With B, ch 16.
1st rnd: (RS). Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st in each of last 2 ch. Working into rem loops of foundation ch, sl st in each of first 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st in each of last 2 ch. Fasten off.
Mug With C, ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 13 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 15 sc.
Next 9 rows: As 3rd row.
Next 3 rows: With E, as 3rd row. Break E.
Next 5 rows: With C, as 3rd row.
Next row: Skip first st. Sl st in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st in each of last 2 sc. Turn work clockwise and work 8 sc down side edge.
Handle: Ch 10. Join with sl st to side of Mug 2 rows above E stripe. Work sl st in each ch or ch 10. Rejoin with sl st to Mug and cont working sc evenly around, working 2 sc in each corner. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop Join E with sl st at to corner of Mug. Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off, overlap end of loop and secure.
FINISHING Sew Coffee at top of Mug as shown in picture.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread”, Size 10: 1 ball 226 Natural.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 12 mesh = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in filet pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PLACEMAT
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 107; dc in 8th ch from hook, [ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in next ch] 33 times; turn – 34 mesh.
Row 2: Ch 5, dc in next dc, [2 dc in next ch-1 space, dc in next dc] 32 times, ch 2, skip 2 ch of turning ch, dc in next ch; turn – 32 blocks and 2 mesh.
Row 3: Ch 5, dc in next 7 dc, * [ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc] 4 times **, dc in next 12 dc; repeat from * to last 2 blocks and 1 mesh, end at **; dc in next 6 dc, ch 2, dc in 3rd ch of ch-5; turn.
Rows 4-58: Continue in this manner, following chart and working blocks and meshes as charted.
Edging
Ch 1, sc in first dc, * [2 sc in next space, sc in next dc] twice, picot; repeat from * 15 times more, 2 sc in next space, sc in next dc, (3 sc, picot, 3 sc) all in next ch-5 space, [2 sc around post of next dc, sc in ch at base of same dc, picot, 2 sc in next space] 28 times, 2 sc around post of next dc, (sc, picot, sc) all in free loop of beginning ch, ** [2 sc in next space, sc in next free loop of next ch] twice, picot; repeat from ** 15 times more, 2 sc in next space, sc in free loop of next ch, (3 sc, picot, 3 sc) all in next ch-5 sp, [2 sc around post of next dc, sc in top of same dc, picot, 2 sc in next space] 28 times, 2 sc around post of next dc, sc in same dc as first sc, picot; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 334 Buff A, 321 Gold B, 319 Cherry Red C, 3950 Charcoal D, 256 Carrot E, and 528 Medium Purple F
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Silverware holder measures 7¾" (19.5 cm) from top of center feather to bottom of body.
gauge: 6 sc = 1½" (4 cm); 6 rounds = 1½" (4 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
TURKEY
Head
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker on first st.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Body (make 2) 
Rounds 1–6: Work same as Rounds 1–6 of head. Do not join or fasten off at end of last round.
Round 7: *Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—42 sc.
Round 8: *Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—48 sc.
Round 9: *Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—54 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Beak
With B, ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, 5 hdc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch, slip st in last ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Wattle
With C, ch 6, sc in 3rd ch from hook, slip st in each remaining ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Wing (make 2) 
With D, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc; leave remaining sc unworked, turn—6 sc.
Row 3: Ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, sc in each sc across, turn—8 sc.
Rows 4–7: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 twice. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through ends of rows and pull tightly to gather.
Leg (make 2) 
With B, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each remaining ch across, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: *Ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, slip st in end of Row 1; repeat from * twice; working in opposite side of foundation ch, slip st in each ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Tail Feather (make 5) 
With B, ch 12.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, hdc in next 5 ch, dc in next ch, 6 dc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next 5 ch, sc in last 4 ch; change to E, turn—26 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts, hdc in next 5 sts, 2 dc in next 4 sts, hdc in next 5 sts, sc in last 6 sts; change to F, turn—30 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sts, 2 dc in next 6 sts, sc in last 12 sts—36 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph for placement of all pieces.
Arrange beak slightly above center of face and sew in place. Sew wattle on top of beak. Sew buttons for eyes above beak and wattle.
Overlap head on first 4 rounds of 1 body piece and sew in place.
Sew wings to head and body.
Position feathers to form a fan, slightly overlapping first 6 rows, and sew together with strand of E. With right side facing, pin feathers to back side of body.
With wrong sides together, sew body pieces together, leaving opening between 3 center feathers unsewn.
Sew legs in place.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein of 254 Pumpkin
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Table Topper measures 54” (137 cm) in diameter.
gauge: 15 ch sts = 4” (10 cm). First 2 rounds = 6” (15 cm) in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
Ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (right side): *Ch 4, place marker (pm), ch 3, pm, ch 4, slip st in ring; repeat from * 5 times; join with a slip st in first ch – 6 large loops.
Round 2: Slip st in each ch to next marked ch, *ch 5, pm, ch 6, pm, ch 5, slip st in next marked st, ch 2, slip st in next marked st on next large loop; repeat from * around.
Round 3: Slip st in each ch to next marked ch, *ch 6, pm, ch 10, pm, ch 6, slip st in next marked st, ch 5, slip st in next marked st on next large loop; repeat from * around.
Round 4: Slip st in each ch to next marked ch, *ch 7, pm, ch 14, pm, ch 7, slip st in next marked st, ch 9, slip st in next marked st on next large loop; repeat from * around.
Round 5: Slip st in each ch to next marked ch, *ch 8, pm, ch 19, pm, ch 8, slip st in next marked st, ch 13, slip st in next marked st on next large loop; repeat from * around.
Round 6: Slip st in each ch to next marked ch, *ch 9, pm, ch 25, pm, ch 9, slip st in next marked st, ch 18, slip st in next marked st on next large loop; repeat from * around.
Round 7: Slip st in each ch to next marked ch, *ch 10, pm, ch 30, pm, ch 10, slip st in next marked st, ch 24, slip st in next marked st on next large loop; repeat from * around.
Round 8: Slip st in each ch to next marked ch, *ch 11, pm, ch 36, pm, ch 11, slip st in next marked st, ch 29, slip st in next marked st; repeat from * around.
Round 9: Slip st in each ch to next marked ch, *ch 12, pm, ch 42, pm, ch 12, slip st in next marked st, ch 35, slip st in next marked st on next large loop; repeat from * around.
Round 10: Slip st in each ch to next marked ch, *ch 13, pm, ch 42, pm, ch 13, slip st in next marked st, ch 41, slip st in next marked st on next large loop; repeat from * around.
Round 11: Ch 1 (does not count as first st), pm, *slip st in each of next 42 ch, ending at next marker, *ch 42, slip st in ch after next marked st on next loop, slip st in each of next 41 ch, ending at next marker; repeat from * 4 times, ch 42; join with a slip st in first slip st – 504 sts; 6 sets of 42 slip sts; 6 ch-42 loops)
Round 12: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), skip next 2 sts, *dc in next st, ch 2, skip next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5 – 168 ch-2 spaces.
Round 13: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 2 dc in same ch-2 space, 3 dc in each ch-2 space around – 504 dc.
Round 14: *Ch 3, skip next 3 dc, (tr, picot, tr) in space before next dc, ch 3, skip next 3 dc, slip st in space before next dc; repeat from * around. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 885 Delft Blue A and 320 Cornmeal B.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 14 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTES
Leave a 4” tail for fringe at beginning and end of each row.
To join at beginning of each row, make a slip knot and place on hook. Work first st as usual.
When working Adc on wrong side rows, insert hook in front loop of st 1 row below on back side of work (on right side).
Special Abbreviation
Anchored double crochet (Adc): insert hook in both loops of next st and draw up a loop, yo, insert hook in front loop of st 1 row below same st and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops on hook, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

PLACEMAT
With A, ch 59 loosely. Fasten off. Turn.
