Row 1 (Right Side): Join A with sc in back bar of last ch made; sc in back bar of each remaining ch across – 59 sc. Fasten off.
Row 2: With wrong side facing, join B with sc in front loop of first st; sc in front loop of each remaining st across. Fasten off.
Row 3: With right side facing join A with Adc in first st made; sc in back loop of next st, Adc in next st; [sc in back loop of next 5 sts, Adc in next st, sc in back loop of next st, Adc in next st] 7 times – 16 Adc and 43 sc. Fasten off.
Row 4: With wrong side facing, join B with sc in front loop of first st, Adc in next st; [sc in front loop of next 7 sts, Adc in next st] 7 times; sc in front loop of last st – 8 Adc and 51 sc. Fasten off.
Row 5: With right side facing, join A with Adc in first st; [sc in back loop of next st, Adc in next st] 29 times – 30 Adc and 29 sc. Fasten off.
Row 6: With wrong side facing, join B with sc in front loop of first st, sc in front loop of next 4 sts; [Adc in next st, sc in front loop of next 7 sts] 6 times; Adc in next st, sc in front loop of last 5 sts – 7 Adc and 52 sc. Fasten off.
Row 7: With right side facing, join A with Adc in first st, sc in back loop of next 3 sts; [Adc in next st, sc in back loop of next st, Adc in next st, sc in back loop of next 5 sts] 6 times; Adc in last st – 16 Adc and 43 sc. Fasten off.
Row 8: Repeat Row 6.
Row 9: Repeat Row 5.
Row 10: Repeat Row 4.
Rows 11-42: Repeat Rows 3-10, 4 more times.
Rows 43-45: Repeat Rows 3-5.
Row 46: With right side facing, join A with slip st in back loop of first st, slip st in back loop of each remaining st across – 59 slip sts. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Matching row colors, add one strand of fringe to each side of placemat, inserting tails into fringe before tightening. Trim fringe to 1”, or to desired length.

materials: Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 14 hdc and 10 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Version
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook.
Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed.
Ch 2 does not count as hdc.
Stripe Pattern
Work 3 rows with MC.
Work 2 rows with A.
Work 2 rows with MC.
Work 2 rows with B.
Work 2 rows with MC.
Work 2 rows with A.
Work 3 rows with MC.
These 16 rows form Stripe Pat.
With MC, ch 29.
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch and each ch to end of ch. Turn. 27 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in 1st hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc through back loop only. *1 hdc in next hdc through front loop only. 1 hdc in next hdc through back loop only. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
2nd row of Stripe Pat is now complete. Rep last row until 16 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Fasten off.
Edging: With RS of work facing, join B with sl st to any corner of Pot Holder. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 12. Join with sl st to first ch- loop made. *Work 23 sc along side of Pot Holder to next corner. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in corner. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Solid Version
With MC, work as given for Stripe Version, omitting all references to color changes.
Edging: With B, work as given for edging for Stripe Version.
Daisy Motif: Make 2 Daisy Motifs (one for each Pot Holder).
With Yellow, ch 5. Join in rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in rnd. Join White with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With White, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5 petals.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in missed sc in last rnd. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in next missed sc in last rnd. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5 petals.
Note: 5 petals from 2nd rnd should alternate with 5 petals from 3rd rnd. Fasten off.
Sew 1 Daisy Motif to each Pot Holder at corner with loop as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays™ (2.8 oz/80 g; 138 yds/126 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Picot = Ch 3. Slip stitch in first chain.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = Approx 5" [12.5 cm] diameter.
instructions:
Note: To join Motifs as you work, while working Picots in 3rd rnd, sl st to Picot of adjoining Motifs as seen in Assembly Diagram.

Motif (make 22)
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 2. Skip next dc. *3 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc (center dc of 3-dc group). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 tr. Picot. 1 tr. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Skip next dc. *1 sc in next dc. Skip next dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 tr. Picot. 1 tr. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Skip next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.

Fasten off.

FINISHING
Join Motifs tog as seen in Assembly Diagram.

materials: RED HEART® Holiday: 2 balls 1360 Aran w/Gold A
1 ball each 9560 Wine/Gold B and 6560 Hunter/Gold C
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 11 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
RUNNER
First Side
With A, starting at center, ch 214.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook, * ch 2, skip next ch, sc in next ch, ch 2, skip next ch, dc in next 2 ch; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 dc, ch 3, * sc in next 2 dc, ch 3; repeat from * to last 2 sts; sc in dc, sc in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, skip first sc, dc in next sc, * ch 2, sc in ch-3 space, ch 2, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across; turn.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 five more times, changing to B in last st of last row.
Border
Row 1: With B, repeat Row 2.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first sc, dc in next dc, * ch 2, sc in ch-3 space, ch 2, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across; work one more dc in last sc changing to C; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 3 dc, ch 3, * sc in next 2 dc, ch 3; repeat from * to last 3 sts; sc in next 2 dc and in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in first sc, dc in next 2 sc, * ch 2, sc in ch-3 space, ch 2, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * to last 3 sc; ddc in next 2 sc, 2 dc in last sc changing to B; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 4 dc, ch 3, * sc in next 2 dc, ch 3; repeat from * to last 4 sts; sc in next 3 dc, sc in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in first sc, dc in next 3 sc, * ch 2, sc in ch-3 space, ch 2, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * to last 4 sc; ddc in next 3 sc, 2 dc in last sc. Fasten off.
Second Side
With right side facing, attach A in first st of beginning ch and work across remaining loops as follows:
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, skip first st, dc in next st, * ch 2, skip next st, sc in next st, ch 2, skip next st, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * across; turn.
Complete same as First Side.
Crocheted with sparkly yarn and embellished with holly leaves and berries, this table runner will grace your table all season long.

Edging
Row 1: With right side facing, skip edge of first Border, attach B at short end of First Side; ch 1, work 42 sc evenly across First and Second Side edge, leaving Second Border unworked, turn
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first sc, dc in next sc, [ch 2, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 2, skip next sc, dc in next 2 sc] 8 times, work one more dc in last sc changing to C; turn.
Rows 3-6: Repeat Border Rows 3-6. Fasten off. 
Repeat Edging on opposite short end.

LEAVES (Make 8)
With C, ch 14; sc in 2nd ch from hook, * sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, (tr, ch 3, slip st in top of tr, tr) all in next ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, (tr, ch 3, slip st in top of tr, tr) all in next ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next 2 ch, ch 3 **, slip st in last sc made; working on opposite side of beginning ch, sc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next st, (tr, ch 3, slip st in top of tr, tr) all in next st, dc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, (tr, ch 3, slip st in top of tr, tr) all in next st, dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; slip st in first sc. Fasten off leaving long end to sew leaf to runner.

BERRY (Make 6)
With B, ch 2, 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off leaving long end to sew to runner.

FINISHING
Sew corners of Border and Edge rows together. Sew groups of 4 leaves with 3 berries to runner as shown. With sewing thread and needle sew gold beads in middle of each berry.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread,” Size 10: 1 ball 420 Cream.
abbreviations: beg cl (beginning cluster) = ch 5, * [yo] 3 times, draw up a loop in ch-2 space, [yo and draw through 2 loops] 3 times; repeat from * 3 more times in same space, yo and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
cl (cluster) = * [yo] 3 times, draw up a loop in ch-2 space, [yo and draw through 2 loops] 3 times; repeat from * 4 more times in same space, yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook.
picot = ch 3, sc in 3rd ch from hook.
gauge: Flower Motif = 2¾” x 2¾” after blocking. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PLACEMAT
First Flower Motif
Round 1: Ch 2; 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 5, [dc in next sc, ch 2] 7 times; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-5 – 8 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first space, beg cl in same space, ch 10, [cl in next space, ch 10] 7 times; join with a slip st in top of beg cl. Fasten off.
Second Flower Motif
Rounds 1 and 2: Work as First Flower Motif.
Round 3: Slip st in first space, beg cl in same space, ch 5, holding motifs wrong sides together sc in corresponding ch-10 loop of completed motif, ch 5, cl in next space on working motif, ch 5, sc in next ch-10 loop on completed motif, ch 5, * cluster in next space, ch 10; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off.
Repeat Second Flower Motif until 5 rows of 7 motifs in all are joined, joining on one or 2 sides as required.
Fill In Lace (Work in spaces between all motifs)
Round 1: Ch 2; 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 5, sc in any ch-5 space between motifs, [ch 5, slip st in next sc on Fill in Lace, ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space] 7 times, ch 5, slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Border
Join thread in any ch-10 loop; ch 1, (3 sc, picot, 3 sc, 3 picots, 3 sc, picot, 3 sc) all in each ch-10 loop around AND work (3 sc, picot, 3 sc) all in each ch-5 loop around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Finishing
Block to measurements.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 451 Parakeet A, 431 Pumpkin B, 397 Wasabi C, and 493 French Rose D.
abbreviations: A, B, C and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Table Mat Doily measures about 11 x 21” [28 x 53.5 cm].
gauge: 6 shells = 4” [10 cm]; 9 rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 122.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *skip next 3 ch, shell in next ch, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across—15 shells
Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), turn, dc in first sc, ch 3, sc in center dc of next shell, *ch 7, sc in center dc of next shell; repeat from * across, ch 3, dc in last sc—15 sc, 2 dc, 14 ch-7 spaces, and 2 ch-3 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first dc, shell in next sc, *sc in center of next ch-7 space, shell in next sc; repeat from * across, sc in last dc.
Rows 4–9: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 three times and change to B in last st of Row 9.
Fasten off A.
Rows 10 and 11: With B, repeat Rows 2 and 3 once and change to C in last st of Row 11.
Fasten off B.
Rows 12–17: With C, repeat Rows 2 and 3 three times and change to D in last st of Row 17.
Fasten off C.
Rows 18 and 19: With D, repeat Rows 2 and 3 once and change to A in last st of Row 19.
Rows 20–29: With A, repeat Rows 2 and 3 five times and change to B in last st of Row 29.
Fasten off A.
Rows 30–89: Repeat Rows 10–29 three more times, do not fasten off A at the end of Row 89.
Row 90: With A, repeat Row 2.
Do not fasten off A.
EDGING
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, turn, work an odd number of sc evenly spaced along each of the four sides and work 3 sc in each corner; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off A.
Round 2: With right side facing, join B with sc in any st, sc in each st around, working 3 sc in center sc of each 3-sc corner; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off B.
Round 3: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in any st, ch 1, hdc in each st around, working 3 hdc in center sc of each 3-sc corner; join with slip st in first hdc.
Fasten off C.
Round 4: With right side facing, join A with sc in st immediately following any 3-hdc corner, [*dc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * to next 3-hdc corner, skip first st of corner, (dc, [ch 1, dc] 3 times) in center st of corner, skip last st of corner, sc in next st] 4 times omitting last sc; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off A.
Surface Slip Stitch Round: With right side facing, insert hook in space between any 2 sts of Round 3 and draw up a loop of D, *insert hook in next space between sts of Round 3, yarn over and draw loop through fabric and through loop on hook (surface slip st made); repeat from * all the way around.
Fasten off D.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block doily to finished measurements.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion 3: 4 balls 926 Bridal White
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.25 mm [US D-3]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parentheses into specified st or sp
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Table runner measures 15” x 50” (38 x 127 cm).
gauge: Star = 6” (15 cm) diameter between points. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Star Table
Runner
Lovely lacy snowflakes add charm to tabletop or mantle. Worked in size 3 thread, and joined as you crochet, this will add elegance to your holiday.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in top of first cluster, *ch 2, (tr, ch 3, tr) in next sc, ch 2**, sc in next tr cl; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—12 tr.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, *ch 2, dc in next tr, ch 2, (tr cl, ch 3, tr cl) in next ch-3 sp, ch 2, dc in next tr, ch 2**, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—12 tr cl.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, *ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, dc cl in next ch-3 sp, ch 3, slip st in top of last dc cl made – picot made, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3**, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc – 6 picots. Fasten off.
Second Star (2 points joined)
Rounds 1-4: Repeat Rounds 1-4 of first star.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, [ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, dc cl in next ch-3 sp, ch 3, slip st in top of last dc cl made – picot made, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next sc] 4 times, *ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, dc cl in next ch-3 sp, ch 1, with wrong sides together, slip st in corresponding picot on previous star, ch 1, slip st in top of last dc cl made on current star – joined picot made, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3**, sc in next sc; repeat from * to ** once; join with slip st in first sc—6 picots. Fasten off.
Third through Tenth Stars
Work 8 more stars same as second star, joining in a strip, skipping 1 point on each side of stars.
NOTE
When joining 3 stars in a corner, join last star with slip st to same picot where other star was already joined.
SPECIAL STITCHES
dc cl (double crochet cluster) = [Yarn over, insert hook in next space, yarn over, draw yarn through st, yarn over, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook] twice in same space, yarn over, draw yarn through 3 loops on hook.
tr cl (treble crochet cluster) = *Yarn over (twice), insert hook in next space, yarn over, draw yarn through st, [yarn over, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook] twice; repeat from * once in same space, yarn over, draw yarn through 3 loops on hook.
2-tr/dc cl (2 treble crochet/double crochet cluster) = *Yarn over (twice), insert hook in next space, yarn over, draw yarn through st, [yarn over, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook] twice; repeat from * once in same space, yarn over, insert hook in next sc, yarn over, draw yarn through st, yarn over, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook, yarn over, draw yarn through 3 loops on hook.
CENTER STRIP
First Star
Ch 4, join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, dc in ring (ch 2, dc counts as first dc cl), ch 2, *dc cl in ring, ch 2; repeat from * 4 more times; join with slip st in first dc cl—6 dc cl.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, *ch 3, tr cl in next ch-2 space, ch 3, sc in next dc cl; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 3, 2-tr/dc cl in next ch-2 space and next sc—6 cl.
Designed by Susan Lowman

AUNT LYDIA’S STAR TABLE RUNNER | CROCHET    1 of 3

FIRST SIDE STRIP
First Star (3 points joined)
Rounds 1–4: Repeat Rounds 1–4 of first star on center strip.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, [ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, dc cl in next ch-3 sp, work picot, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next sc] 3 times, *ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, dc cl in next ch-3 sp, ch 1, with wrong sides together, slip st in next picot on first star of center strip after 2 picot joins, ch 1, slip st in top of last dc cl made on current star – joined picot made, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3**, sc in next sc; repeat from * once, joining with slip st to next picot on same center star (where first and second stars on center strip were already joined); repeat from * to ** once, joining with slip st to next picot on second star on center strip; join with slip st in first sc—6 picots. Fasten off.
Second Star (4 points joined)
Rounds 1–4: Repeat Rounds 1–4 of first star on center strip.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, [ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, dc cl in next ch-3 sp, ch 3, slip st in top of last dc cl made – picot made, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next sc] 2 times, *ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, dc cl in next ch-3 sp, ch 1, with wrong sides together, slip st in corresponding picot on previous star, ch 1, slip st in top of last dc cl made on current star – joined picot made, ch 3, sc in next tr cl, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3**, sc in next sc; repeat from * 2 times, joining to corresponding picot of appropriate star, then repeat from * to ** once; join with slip st in first sc—6 picots. Fasten off.
Third through Ninth Stars
Work 7 more stars same as second star, joining in a strip across side of center strip, following assembly diagram for placement.
SECOND SIDE STRIP
Make and join 9 more stars, joining to center strip same as first side strip, following assembly diagram for placement.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Pin table runner to measurements with 3” (8 cm) between points on sides and 6” between points diagonally. Spray with water and allow to dry.
ABBREVIATIONS
ch = chain; cl = cluster; dc = double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); tr = treble crochet; [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified; ( ) = work directions in parentheses into specified st or sp; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Sizes U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Beg V-st (beginning V-stitch) = [Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc] in indicated space
Surface sl st (surface sl stitch) = With yarn on WS, insert hook in indicated stitch or space. Yoh and pull up a loop to RS and through loop on hook
V-st (V-stitch) = (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in indicated stitch
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes 
• Spider web is worked in surface sl stitching in straight lines and concentric circles. 
• When instructed to work into a V-stitch, work into the ch-1 sp of the V-stitch. 
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st. 
TABLE TOPPER 
With A, make an adjustable ring: 
Wrap yarn into ring, ensuring that tail falls behind working yarn. 
Grip ring and tail firmly between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yo (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work sts of first rnd in ring, working over both strands (tail and ring). After first rnd of sts is worked, pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring. 
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 12 hdc in ring. Join. 12 hdc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 24 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 hdc.
4th rnd: Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. *V - st in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 V-sts and 24 hdc. 
5th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 V-sts and 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc.  Join. 8 V-sts and 48 hdc. 
7th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. *V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 V-sts and 64 hdc. 
8th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 72 hdc. 
9th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. *V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 V-sts and 88 hdc.
10th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 12 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 12 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 96 hdc. 
11th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 104 hdc.
12th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 14 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 14 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 112 hdc.
13th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 15 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 15 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 120 hdc. 
14th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 16 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 16 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 128 hdc.
15th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 17 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 17 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 136 hdc.
16th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 19 hdc. *V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 19 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 V-sts and 152 hdc.
17th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 20 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 20 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 160 hdc. 
18th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 22 hdc. *V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 22 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 V-sts and 176 hdc.
19th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 23 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in each of next V-st. 1 hdc in next 23 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 184 hdc. 
20th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 25 hdc. *V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 25 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 V-sts and 200 hdc.
21st rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 26 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 26 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 208 hdc.
22nd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 28 hdc. *V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 28 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 V-sts and 224 hdc.
23rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 29 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 29 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 232 hdc. 
24th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 30 hdc. *Skip next hdc. V-st in next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 30 hdc. Rep from * around. Skip last hdc. Join. 8 V-sts and 240 hdc.
25th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 4 (counts as tr). 2 tr in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next hdc. 1 tr in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 12 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 tr in next hdc. Skip next hdc. 3 tr in next V-st. Skip next hdc. Rep from * 7 times more. Skip next hdc. 1 tr in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 12 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 tr in next hdc. Skip last hdc. Join. Eight 3-tr groups, 16 tr, 64 dc, 64 hdc, and 96 sc. Fasten off.
Edging: 26th rnd: With RS facing, join B with sc in any st. Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 264 sc. Fasten off. 
Webbing 
Work each Webbing Line from an outer point to the outer point at the opposite edge. When instructed to work over a "st" , you may be working over a V-st or hdc. When crossing over a previously made line, you may need to elongate the surface sl stitch in order to work over the center of the table topper.
 
Webbing Line:  With RS facing, insert hook from front to back between reverse sc and center st of any 3-tr group, place B-color sl knot on hook, draw through to RS. *insert hook between next 2 rounds, surface sl st over next st. Rep from * across working last st over center st of 3-tr group at opposite point. Fasten off. Rep 3 times. 
Webbing Rnd:  With RS facing, insert hook from front to back in any sp between Rnds 2 and 3, place B-color sl knot on hook, draw through to RS, surface sl st in each sp around. Join with sl st in first surface sl st. Fasten off. 
Rep Webbing Round between Rnds 5 and 6, Rnds 9 and 10, Rnds 14 and 15, and Rnds 20 and 21.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet Thread, Size 3: 5 balls 201 White A, 4 balls 423 Maize B
4” (10 cm) wide piece of cardboard for making Fringe
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Runner measures 45” (114 cm) long by 20” (51 cm) wide.
gauge: 27 sts = 5” (13 cm); 11 rows worked in shell pattern = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
RUNNER
With A, ch 212.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each in ch across; turn—211 sc.
Row 2 (Wrong Side) Ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip 2 sc, 5 dc in next sc (shell made), skip 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across; change to B in last st (see Special Technique), turn—36 sc, 35 shells.
Row 3 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc now and throughout), 2 dc in same first st, *skip 2 dc, sc in next dc, skip 2 dc**, 5 dc in next sc; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, 3 dc in last sc; turn—6 dc, 35 sc, 34 shells.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *skip 2 dc, 5 dc in next sc, skip 2 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across; change to A in last st, turn—36 sc, 35 shells.
Row 5 (Right Side): Ch 3, 2 dc in same first st, *skip 2 dc, sc in next dc, skip 2 dc**, 5 dc in next sc; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, 3 dc in last sc; turn—6 dc, 35 sc, 34 shells.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *skip 2 dc, 5 dc in next sc, skip 2 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across; change to B in last st, turn—36 sc, 35 shells.
Rows 7-50: Repeat Rows 3-6 consecutively.
Rows 51-52: Repeat Rows 3-4. Fasten off B.
Row 53: With A, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), 2 hdc in same first st, *hdc in next dc, skip next dc, sc in next dc, skip next dc, hdc in next dc, 3 hdc in next sc; repeat from * across; do not fasten off, turn—178 hdc, 35 sc.
FIRST EDGING
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Rows 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
SECOND EDGING
Attach A on Right Side of opposite side of foundation chain on Row 1 of Runner.
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
FRINGE
Wrap A around cardboard 108 times. Wrap B around cardboard 108 times. Cut one side for Fringe. Working from the Wrong Side, hold 1 strand of A and 1 strand of B together and fold in half. Insert hook through edge of Runner and draw folded ends of strands through to form loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull ends to tighten. Trim Fringe evenly.
Referring to photo for placement, add Fringe to both sides of each stripe and Edgings.
Note: Carry unused color alongside of work to be covered by Fringe later.
Special Technique
Change color: At end of stitch, with 2 loops left on hook, drop first color; pick up new color, yarn over, draw new color through both loops to complete the stitch.
FINISHING
Weave in loose ends and block.

materials: Bernat® All in One™ Blanket Granny™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 178 yds/163 m) Contrast A Olive You (65011) 1 ball or 3 Squares
Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Misty Green (10878) 1 ball or 94 yds/86 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
5" [12.5 cm] piece of cardboard for Tassels.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: Motif = Approx 10½" [26.5 cm] square. 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
TABLE RUNNER
Motif (With A, make 3).
Notes: 
•  Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest section of color rep) from center of ball, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
•  All color changes occur at end of rnd where colors are spliced together, and should align with sl st at end of rnd.
•  Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. 
•  If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and lightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. 
•  If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
•  If splicing is visible on RS adjust sts so splice sits to WS, or work over splice on next rnd.
• At end of final rnd Motif should measure 10½" [26.5 cm] square. Cut yarn where Color 5 (longest section of color rep) ends, leaving approx 42" [106.5 cm] tail at end of Motif for joining. 
• Begin next Motif with Color 1 and rep 5 rnds for each Motif.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
See Diagram.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1 **(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. 
Fasten off, leaving 42" [106.5 cm] tail.
Border
Note: Turn work at end of each rnd.
1st rnd:  (Joining rnd - RS). Join B with sl st to any corner ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp.** 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Sc2tog in same ch-3 sp and corresponding ch-3 sp of joining Motif. 1 sc in ch-3 sp just worked. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once.*** (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to *** once more. 1 sc in first ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.  256 sc and 8 ch-1 sps.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each sc to next ch-1 sp. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp.** 1 sc in each sc to one st before sc2(3)tog. Sc3tog. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in each sc to next ch-1 sp.*** (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to *** once more. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 3rd rnd.
Tassels (Make 2)
Wrap B around a 5" [12.5 cm] piece of cardboard 10 times. Tie through loops securely at one end. Cut across other end and trim evenly. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Attach 1 Tassel to each end of Table Runner.
